KT1Aqf5K2j4BqisATii09w.text: Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen is amazing! I went with one of my best friends this summer. The food and service is amazing! I definitely recommend!

xtHBSDlLKOFUeuvaZJnD9A.text: Came in on a Friday night at 9 and there were surprisingly a good amount of people! Didn't have to wait though. I got the curry chicken hot pot and my brother got the fire dragon roll. Service was good, water was never empty! Their menu has a lot of different options, great place for people who have different dietary needs.

kHPcDKwYBb9V_o5Gkmp4Kg.text: I have fond memories of this particular location because it used to house a delight restaurant called Lo Cascio.  We dined at Lo Cascio for decades. Therefore, we were excited to sample the offerings of the restaurant that had taken its place. Would it be just as good, or would it be just passable.  The verdict is still out, and it will most likely require a return visit.  We came here on a Friday Night, and the place was nearly packed. The decor has certainly been updated to modern standards, and looked quite inviting and elegant. It definitely departed from the conventional layout that the former occupants.  We wanted to give this place an honest try on our first visit, so we ordered a sampling of various dishes that would provide us the breadth of their offerings.   For starters, we ordered the California & Cucumber Sushi Roll.s This is a typical standard fare that is offered by many restaurants, and should provide us with a good introduction.  Unfortunately, I am not sure what happened this evening, but the rolls were very dry. They were so dry that it left a definitive sandy texture in our mouths.   Next up was the Gyoza. We have had this in many ways, and prefer the steamed version. However, the fried version works just as well. Except in this particular instance, it was completely overdone. The wrapper was burned on the edges, and to top it all off; the meat in the interior didn't cook all the way through. Therefore, it tasted under cooked.  After the initial fails, the rest of our meals were quite palatable. The Udon was juicy and delicately spiced. Just the perfect temperature for a cold evening, such as we were having this particular evening.  The Chicken Skewer and the Korean Spicy Sweet and Sour Chicken provided delightfully distinct flavors for the main repast. The Chicken Skewers were lathered in an amazing semi-sweet sauce that just enlivened our palates.  Along with the prompt and attentive service, our overall experience was good - but it wasn't great. The opening salvo of fails was disheartening, but in the end; it proved to be an adequate dining experience.  We will have to give this place another try, at a different time to see how consistent they are in their meal preparation and presentation.

Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Udon

dig2A6DRV09iw4mD-Pcltg.text: Great food! Great service! My fiance and I love it. The sushi is one of a kind and there is always a place to sit. The bar also has amazing drinks and you always get treated like your their top priority.

12KcY72y-gy21D67Gj3LSw.text: Horrible service and horrible sushi. I sat at the bar in the back, and the bartenders (blonde) never did hello. She simply handed me menus. I ordered the wasabi hamachi and received 2/5 good pieces. The other 3 had hard as a rock pieces and one wasn't even digestible.   I then ordered a snow crab hand roll and fresh wasabi; I had to wait 10 minutes for fresh wasabi.   Bartender didn't say you're welcome once. I said thank you 4x. Cmon. This place is not for someone who knows their sushi.

auMnk9UuiRCgcsA37udg1w.text: One of my fav sushi places! Great happy hour!! make sure when you go in you order the yaki udon. crowd favorite amon my friends and I!!

98lqUel5yGb7GD0UgWxh2g.text: Really great meal here! This was my first hot pot experience and I really enjoyed it. We got the coconut curry hot pot and it was delicious! Will come back.

bqhYt9aYP5T_42L4UkFvjQ.text: We love this place and its delightful atmosphere.  Plenty of parking and very craveable food.  We love their sushi offerings, but I have an insatiable desire for their meatball skewers.  The Umami flavor of these is off the charts.  The shrimp tempura was perfect.  And we always get a sushirito.

YwDPr_nM522TkgOnMRUJPQ.text: This place is a great restaurant with affordable happy hour! Write a review and get a free gyoza and/or mochi Ice cream :)  The menu is filled with variety from skewers to delicious hot pot options; they also have poke bowls! The prices are definitely worth the drive and time. Happy hour is until 7pm! I would definitely come back in the future!

sp_wnSx01bdRjdrVtClFtg.text: For a city without much Asians and super late night, this is a good spot. Although I'd recommend the hot pot section as those are more authentic Korean dishes and the place is run by Koreans. The grill pork, meat ball, soft shell crabs and salmon Kama are all pretty good. I'd recommend this place as there's a significant lack of Korean food in Phoenix, especially the informal casual drink Korean food that they offer in their hot pot section.

hO2aTdjzBWl1lXkS1pde7Q.text: this place is so cool and perfect for girls meeting. Food here is tasty and many choices. I recommend here!

HKcE9-XyAhy6aL_GNWC-4w.text: First time in was a great experience! A friend recently recommended it and I was in the area this evening. I was very tired, very hungry, and in the mood for a sake bomb and some delicious hot food. I was immediately greeted by my lovely server, Min. She was amazing and service was lightning fast! She was extremely personable as was the rest of the staff. They had some entertaining movies on the screen and another server came over and discussed the Ip Man movie with me. Very great experience after a full day! I had the Chicken grill and it was very satisfying, yet not heavy. I highly recommend. Thank you, Min and staff.

-_4Tf8EnqJYot-5Xxkec4Q.text: Went on a date during Happy Hour and loved everything! Their prices, quality, and service were all on point. Definitely try their sushi burrito!

KQS26pcH0t9rCTQE59zXoQ.text: Ordered gyoza, agadashi tofu, and the jjamppong hot pot. Everything was pretty good! The server answered all of our questions and was helpful.

VoTCKrKUw-1_5gTEQGOwyg.text: Happy hour is good for date night especially if your significant other or friends are only kind of into sushi. I think the meatball skewers are amazing and the sushi(las vegas and tuna roll) are very tasty as well. Definitely one of my go to spots.

I would highly recommend getting one. The menu was pretty good and the service was high quality. We also got some sushi which was pretty fresh and tasty.

sdEzceSVWsR44hSY6LzORg.text: Great place to enjoy Japanese food and alcohol. Food come out fast and customer service is friendly.

XRF207gJxPGZ70CD2gkl6g.text: This place was awesome!  First time here but the music, ambiance and service were great.  Oh the food?  Awesome!  Presentation, quality and uniqueness made us eat way more than we should have.  Chili garlic Edamame and Cheese spam Katsu to start.  Quail egg sashimi was my challenge tonight by my husband...I took the challenge and it was great.  We had the eel sashimi, and a couple house specialties like the jalapeno Vegas roll...bomb dot com!  Definitely a keeper, we will be back again.  By the way, lots of wonderful sakes and sojus to choose from. Yummy!

qTAo6C20T-96lrULVRWg_g.text: Kent was a great server. Sushi was reasonably priced. Definitely will be coming back. This is my new go to Sushi place!

First time trying Korean dish - spicy pork grill was very generous portions. Hot pot was a new and equally delightful experience, we skipped the sushi since we do sushi almost weekly. Nice place, good good and service, will definitely come back!

qS2unvD4vfDr7vNSb-8p_A.text: Excellent Service & Amazing salmon sashimi! First time trying this wonderful restaurant & fall in love . Great menu on sushi rolls & also serve Korean BBQ beef . Def coming back and try their specialty.

nQg7FbUKoXmy9YWIYeNQ2g.text: Great family owned restaurant, the bartender Chuey was extremely courteous and did an excellent job hosting our whole party.  The service here is amazing.  I recommend the Gyoza and Edamame appetizers when coming here.

guj2-wJ3xbtVZkuhJrmCAQ.text: This place is amazing, me and my boyfriend try to come in a few times a month. The service is fantastic (Ask for JoJo) , the food is delicious and the happy hour is great! My favorites are the sausage, chicken, meatball and quail egg skewers are incredible and the Spicy Soft Tofu Hot Pot comforts the soul. If you haven't tried this place you need to get your life together. lol

AITnI6YWzo8vs19kzaJ-KA.text: Amazing sushi and service!  We asked for some speciality rolls and they were happy to meet them for us.  The fresh wasabi  was the icing on the cake.  Can't wait to go back!

x-6fReIw_Xstalo_dbBCVA.text: Very good place love the bulgogi soup this place has the best in town love it. The soup is great and the reverse happy hour is great plus getting the free gyoza for this is golden

H4WSUj9MkuSVrg3jhN8h-w.text: Overall great experience for an Asian fusion place in Phoenix. We went during happy hour and ordered two skewers, a octopus in ponzu sauce appetizer, Jjambbong hot pot and house sake.   Food overall 4 stars - Skewers: both chicken and pork are juicy and tender and very flavorful. - Octopus in ponzu sauce: the flavor in the sauce is well balanced.  - Jjambbong hot pot:  it's hard not to compare with the authentic hot pot I had in California... The soup tasted like the ramen package seasoning and little diluted for my liking. Probably would taste really good if you come in hungry late night lol  Services and environment 5 stars - Nice atmosphere and very attentive services! I would definitely recommend for groups and pre-game LOL

LBw9wZPIc3aDLGryi39TJw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while and was expecting it to be a pretty upscale sushi restaurant. However, it's not and that makes it so much better! A group of friends came here before a Rising game for happy hour and the food was quick and delicious. I think we ordered three rounds of food while we were there. Always looking for a go-to sushi spot in Scottsdale and this is probably it!

_TSkQ4V-EI83XsmOmkPG_Q.text: Their grilled salmon gets me every time!! It's possibly my favorite in Scottsdale. So crunchy and delicious. They have a good deal on sake bombs and yelp check ins. I have a gluten allergy and although most of their menu isn't favorable for me than informed me of what was safe for me to eat. As they stated most of their sushi menu is free game for me too.

es7FIvXlBqdKLeaRtRjqIQ.text: Just passing through looking for some good sushi. This place is great! Recommend the Togarashi Tuna Roll and the Jalapeno vegas roll. Sashimi was excellent as well.

fdVROGUJYAc54O1169k9QQ.text: Stayed at an airport hotel traveling thru Phoenix Sky Harbor.  This gem was a couple of miles away. Ate early and hit Happy Hour.  Shared a Sashimi combo bowl, chicken and meatball skewers, edamame, and egg roll.  Sashimi was amazing, fresh, flavorful. Combo bowl indicated vegetables, which were not apparent- some shredded daikon?  But sushi rice in bowl was great. Meatballs were a little off-but couldn't quite put my finger on what was off. They were all eaten anyway LOL. Everything else was well prepared and tasty. Happy hour Shapiro on draft $3- Woodbridge wine $6.00.

HSkFMlRJ68gwfAp2yYM8zA.text: Excellent service and food! Great ambience! ... had the bulgolgi and it was excellent. Just like in Myeungdong :)

wPDXm-A5GJ8tQna5AGtmTQ.text: Friendly staff, good food. They were accommodating to our children which is always nice.

qYw07o6SETrldm9SLX86qQ.text: Been coming here for past few weeks. Their happy hours are great for trying out some stuff. I really like their Vegas sushi roll. Can't beat the $2.5 chicken skewers.

HWnJu_VeHeEw-3rC3hea1A.text: Great food and services. I love their grilled salmon salad specifically. Definitely our go to japanese resto now. They have great selection for happy hour.

bdIsgY31tXvJ9ikJqyQ7Dg.text: Amazing food. Perfect late night spot for delicious food and laid back atmosphere. Tried probably half the menu and didn't come across one thing I didn't like.   Definitely try the Shiobiani steak, the bulgogi, and go for the quail eggs if you're feeling adventurous.

LEQo8uxwAlhtXxbuQY38fg.text: Pretty rad, the food is good, the drink specials are bomb and our bartender (Chuey) was great. I had come here a few times before and I wasn't super into it but with the re-open and new bar staff it's great.

3V8v60uyI4-bWqwt5oW6iw.text: great place to hang out with friends. Would come again. Great food and tasty.   Free parking outside and late night dinning

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great place

WRMXhPjppz4FiVZSUasBEQ.text: Food is great and service is fast and helpful. I had a really good dinner with my friend. I had the bulgogi mushroom pot and it tastes sooo good

Ke6jLjeFuQceyQul9NrhaA.text: Food: Japanese/Korean fusion. We tried the tuna tacos, bulgogi tacos, crab cakes, Agedashi tofu, chicken skewers, and gyoza.  The chicken skewers were reminiscent of Japan'd Izakayas--very tasty and smokey. The crab cakes are similar to Japanese croquette--also very good.  The tacos were pretty basic...the shells were straight from a box.  The agedashi tofu was also pretty average. I would recommend cooks to go easy with the salt. Overall, there aren't very many places like this in Phoenix so I give it 3 stars.  This is a cheaper version of Sumomaya.   Ambiance/Service: Excellent and modern presentation. Open late night and reverse happy hour has some good deals. The service was prompt and friendly.   Overall impression: The food is definitely aimed at the American palate. Really cool atmosphere though. I would go back to try the hot pots.

sNxa3whih_helSpJnlbBPg.text: Was in town visiting for a conference and came here for dinner and drinks on a Friday night. The atmosphere is great, a big communal table in the center of the space with a big screen for games. We got the scallop and mushroom yakatori, so good. The poke bowl was so good, and then I got the oden hot pot - so so so good. The best fishcake soup I've had in time. They have soju too! The service is great, food is awesome. Def worth checking out!

1-VHgwnpdKuGu0kpq1OCsw.text: The food was amazing!! Definitely coming back. The wait was not long and the waiter was super nice and funny!! The food was one of the best food places I've ever been too!! It's in a great area!! The people who work here are really nice and funny! This is a great place for kids and adults!! The food comes really fast and it was one of the best restaurants I've ever been too!! The mochi did not have the best consistency but it was pretty goodIf I am ever looking for a place to eat, this would definitely be one of my first picks!!

y_BQtYhT1T7njlOaAQaP2w.text: Love the ambiance of this place, it's a bit dark super clean the bathrooms are nice and clean. The food is delicious their hotspots are really delicious the Kimchi hot pot is delicious, hot and sour, with a delicious spicy  come in everything has been on point. The edamame is delicious and their egg rolls are the best I've had they taste  like they are made in house. This place never disappoints.

Pzv5kvnZc1ERCSaG2uFn-g.text: Awesome place! Service was fantastic and servers were very attentive and made sure to explain the menu to us after finding out it was our first time here. Food portions are rather big so I would suggest sharing when dining with a group or on a date. Definitely would repeat.

09P4Gr1I4b_WXHLoIuTzWw.text: I came into Phoenix for the weekend and was craving sushi. Luckily there was a restaurant close to my hotel. After seeing the amazing reviews, I knew I had to try it!! We came in shortly after 9 and were blessed by the establishment's late night happy hour. The fish was super fresh, the atmosphere was trendy, and the customer service was amazing! We got to watch Cartoon Network while noshing on our rolls and sake bombs! Definitely coming back the next time I'm in town.

71KcaPrwFLRmxMEHQGJmQw.text: Hands down this is the best sushi in the valley! I enjoy going here every couple days - in addition, it's also great that they offer delivery via DoorDash, for when I don't want to leave the couch. Definitely very tasty, looking forward to visiting again!!!! 10/10

5VIBPBLzhtsylqdMw5IU_w.text: Love this place!! Food is delicious, service is quick and always friendly.  Love to go with friends during Happy Hour as to try a lot of the yummy apps on special, especially the Chicken Skewers and Hot Pots.  I love Bei but this is my go to for evening.

9AxtiqtMToCdFIZ-QIO9xw.text: My friend and I came here for dinner. I absolutely love this place! The server greeted us with smile, he escorted us to our table, then he asked if we would like something to drink but didn't rush us to order the food. My friend has been here before but it was my first time!  After we looked at the menu, we decided to order; Las Vegas Roll, Rolled Egg, Poke Bowl (Tuna), Kkanpungi and a special Sea Urchin Sushi ($8.95 for 2 pieces, das expensive!) Lol  Las Vegas Roll came first, we were so hungry and I didn't have a chance to take a picture, it was so... delicious. That's all I can say about this roll.  Poke Bowl came not long after that, we tried it out and it was good. I didn't eat this one too much, okay I know this is weird, I eat tuna sushi just fine because the tuna is wrapped inside of the sushi but when I looked at the Poke Bowl with all those red looking tuna on top of it, I couldn't help it. Lol  Rolled Egg came after that, the food just kept coming man, lol. But this one, not only it smelled so good, it tasted so yummy!  Kkanpungi, this was our FAVORITE dish from this place. It was sweet and spicy, omg I can snack on this everyday! And the portion is perfect for 2 people.  Finally, Sea Urchin sushi... I honestly didn't know what sea urchin is until I googled it. I thought they would serve me the whole sea urchin LOL and my friend told me No! Just the inside of it. I was like, oh boy, I can tell that I won't like it already. I looked at the sushi, I said it's $8.95 for 2pcs, you'd better work... My friend tried it first, he said hmm, it's okay, I had a better one. I poked the yellow thing with my chopstick, shit it looks chewy, I don't trust this. So my friend said let's cut into a small piece and you try it, if you don't like it, I'll eat the rest. I took the small piece, I literally prayed before I ate it LMAO and well... My prayer didn't work, it tasted so TERRIBLE, I almost puked. It tasted so weird, it's slimy and kinda bitter, I felt like eating mucus. MY GOD, Ok I'll stop.  I love this place, for real though. I want to try their other menu, specially the sushi. But, sea urchin, never again. But if you're curious, give it a try. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kkanpungi (so delicious!) and Rolled Egg

f7oFkwOa-w42c8khUPVfsg.text: Really love the Korean food! Been here a few times with my girlfriend and we love it. We recommend the hot pots and the sushi. Definitely coming back! Reminds me of the food my mother would make.

h0Tkj3z7Em5nmk2F6xyR-Q.text: Wow this place was amazing. As someone from Seattle I know and love Asian food and find very few great Asian restaurants here in Scottsdale, though more like this one are starting to pop up.  Loved the Katsu Chicken and the Jalapeno Las Vegas roll, so delicious! Looking forward to coming back often and the best part? It's open until 2 AM

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

sGLsm0jd7j5vwqQDIvy6GQ.text: I came to Zu Izakaya with some friends to get some sushi. We ended up ordering a lot more than just sushi.   I was a little worried at first since you never know how busy a restaurant will be on a Friday, but we were able to get a table for the four of us within 10 minutes of walking through the door. It might've been shorter than that.  This place offers a robust menu. There are dozens of appetizers, sushi roll choices, and hot plates. For those of you looking to get drinks with your food, the sake and beer options are also very vast.   I had gotten a Tempura Roll to start and then the Bulgogi plate for dinner. The serving sizes for both weren't as big as I was expecting, but the flavor over all was very good. The sushi tasted fresh and the bulgogi was satisfying. (Perhaps a little dry in comparison to a AYCE KBBQ place but still good.)  Overall, we had a fun time here. I would probably come back :)

JHcx7xMU37lmCrlFH9Xv_Q.text: This place is great . Bartender Kevin is cool, good sushi, menu,food, cheap pricing, and an enjoyable atmosphere. Will be back again for sure.

Pb0n7BySVEiUp1G2AThhyg.text: I have been in a few times and this is an updated review!  Last night was a gathering of friends and we met up for happy hour.  Zu is known for its happy hour and its quite generous. Plenty of discounts on both food and beverage, my Yelp check in yielded us a warm portion of edamame for free.   Lots of food was ordered including a Beef Hot Pot, That hot pot was pretty amazing and is now on my radar for when I return. Steamy broth with glass noodles and the most savory onion and beef broth I have ever had. This was top notch and completely cravable. Interesting skewers are on the HH list including meatball, chicken wing, lil smokies and a more conventional beef. all were tasty. Mozzarella sticks??? yep out of place on this menu but it's America, and we are adults so why not. These got high marks though it appears the breading has changes since the last time.  Some places make a good California Roll some do not! This was  Zu's short coming but for 4 bucks during happy hour it was all most expected. Filled full with Krab Salad and a sliver of cucumber, and not even a hint of avocado. Spicy tuna was similar, yet better and the yellow tail was as good as any in town.  My buddies were familiar with our server as she was with them. I must say service was just fine throughout our long visit at Zu.  This is one of the coolest and most hip restaurants in the area, I know, I live on Fillmore St. So give it a try and make it a new regular hang out spot like I am about to.

z5f1vPH-ZGmf8YRAvjpVwA.text: During my friends and I last night in Arizona we made a visit to Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen. It's such a cute establishment with slightly dimmed lights and ample out of seatings. This restaurant is split in to two areas where the main dining area is in the front and if you walk outside the bar area is in the back. We were greeted by a kind bartender named Kevin who was so kind to inform us of their amazing happy hour deals. The deals consisted of discounted cocktails, beers, sake, sushi rolls, bowls, bulgogi, and more. The happy hour prices were extremely affordable and covered a lot. I ended up ordering their plum sake and steak bulgogi. The plum sake was sweet, fruity, and a little candy like but still pleasant at the same time.  The steak bulgogi with peppers was a nice portion and very flavorful. It also came with a small bowl of steamed white rice that I enjoyed as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

FYbaLaH0m9YQMcjFnkIB7A.text: Amazing amazing amazing!! I wanted to go to Geisha for valentines but they left us on hold for so long we started yelping up other places in the area and found this one. We were very impressed with the quality of service, food and the fact there was happy hour until 11, score!! Our waiter was super attentive and friendly. Everything we ordered was perfect and the laid back atmosphere definitely puts it at the top of our list for sushi houses. Will definitely be back for more!

Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Calamari is tempura battered and cooked to perfection

phN9brLQAR6XXBTvvMAimA.text: Looking forward to going back to try the hot pots they have, the table next to us got some and they smelled delicious. We had sushi which was good and my 2 yr old enjoyed two of the veggie rolls on the menu.

j_59S5OztdzXmRUv3lZUiw.text: Great happy hour prices for a decent selection of rolls. Fish tasted fresh and provided good portions. Very friendly service.  Also have a wide variety of sake types available with informative diagram about quality. Only complaint I have is the mochi... it was not good at all, very very grainy.

oAu7va6Z9KqbUzUvQ67Gcg.text: Came here for dinner, late one 9:12pm. Barely find one spot of our three left for parking. Awesome food. They are both Japanese and Korean food restaurant.  The sashimi poke is awesome but I did not wanna eat starch for dinner so it was provided without rice. They are decent fresh on the condition of living far from the ocean. I wanna try the oysters but they were not on the menu. My friends told me she loved the skewers and I'm just fine with their chicken & sausage skewers. Their edamame cooks good, as good as Japanese chef.  No alcohol for me. I love them but harmful for health. The hot green tea taste super good. Korean Japanese and Chinese are all good at tea! Their restroom, I only could check the male one... it's clean enough. But you know it really depends on customers' dignity. Finally, love it! The services are also top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

T_3lJxMkvwy1sOQQT7YkWw.text: Wow.. This place has some of the best Asian food I've had. Absolutely everything was phenomenal, from their spicy garlic edamame, to the skewers, sushi and sake!  The garlic edamame was absolutely the best I've had. They even had garlic roasted skewers which are surprisingly very delicious if you mix it with maybe a pork skewer or chicken. There's so many ways to mix and match them. Such a good appetizer or possibly just a meal for everyone to share.  My fiance is a very picky man and has not taken me out for sushi because he doesn't like fish. But the fact that this restaurant has so much options and great ones at that, makes it a place for everyone to enjoy.  The service from Danny was amazing. Very attentive never felt like we are waiting for anything. Very funny and personable server.   I HIGHLY recommend coming here for a great delicious  dinner, an unforgettable one at that!

Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy edamame and skewers in the background. Forgot the name of the sushi but I believe it was a type of garlic spicy tuna roll.

86J4gAJrWZrgOZ3hg2CKHQ.text: My coworkers were hesitate of my yelp abilities until I brought them here. The free order of edamame with a check in on yelp had them laughing on the way there but the great sushi and friendly service had them smiling on the way home. The spicy tuna roll was excellent and the sushi burrito was beautiful! Great little spot with a good vibe!

I love their butter/cheese corn. It's simple but delicious.  If you want to try something a little different, their tang su yuk is a yummy variation of sweet and sour pork.

28nTvjx-IFtc1VJ1GZjILQ.text: Mirin mackerel was really good. Junmai daijingo sake was good. Agedashi tofu was good too. Shishito peppers was a little salty  Skewers were a little too salty as well.

ow_M7LJHSCfXghfWAtvrSg.text: My wife and I and 1 year old just moved here from So-Cal and are on the lookout for a new sushi spot. We saw this one pretty close to where we live and decided to give it a try. It has a great atmosphere but terrible choice of modern pop music (every sad Kygo song).  The food was okay, not expecting anything amazing but it wasnt underwhelming either. Our waiter was really nice but wasnt the brightest when it came to questions about modifying dishes. For instance, one of our party members asked to replace the rice with salad for their chicken dish, to which he replied there would be a $2 upcharge. For switching Rice to Salad, in the dish. I'm sure it wasnt his fault but still that's pretty ridiculous. It also irked me that they had "Give us a Yelp review and get a free dessert", places that do that tend to have overinflated Yelp ratings.  Overall 3/5

q3lvFoNGKg9b7VkeBVToHA.text: Great happy hour options, the Crunch Salmon Roll and Las Vegas Roll are amazing! The Veggie Egg Roll is free if you post on Instagram, it's delicious!

BM0M88eYBhb-pB_s7Bd-Yg.text: Great place for happy hour.  Friendly staff. Poke bowl with ahi is pretty  good for land locked City ! Will go back.

3isZ7Ey0oNcsOFpyLt9HoA.text: I came here for the first time last week, and I've been here 3x since then. The Jjambbong Pot is where it's at...I get it with clear noodles instead of ramen (it's a little extra but it's worth it.) New favorite place.

PVCC4qUD2fH0xQJIrh9tqg.text: This place has wonderful servers (Jojo in particular) who are kind patient and willing to explain things. It's my first time experimenting with some of this food and it as absolutely wonderful. The place is clean and has a wonderful laid back environment.

xVDyla4nqkh3KA93Rns7Lg.text: I love this place  consistently good food, friendly service, and amazing sake! Fuji apple is the best sake I've had. Vegetable roll, coconut curry hot pot and mochi for dessert. Gotta come back to try all the other hot pot flavors!!  I think the bar tender could probably use some work on repeating the order back to the customers just to double check what was actually ordered. Super sweet, and fixed everything but repeating the order would save a lot of time, grief and confusion overall.  no worries tho, I still love this place!

TNLtFhoblqHbq0XQaRvUmA.text: We ate here on a weeknight and it wasn't super busy.  Great service and good food.  I overshot the parking lot and ended up parking in an apartment complex right next door.  No real way to turn around in that spot.  The Mirin Mackerel was very fishy but also very good in terms of the sauce. That said, I didn't finish it.  The Beef Bulgogi was fantastic. I'd come back for that dish alone.  It's a little tight in terms of entry for wheelchairs/powerchairs and there's not a ton of room to park next to booths, but you won't be too much in the way of others. It's doable but didn't seem super spacious.

Happy hour is all night in the bar, but only certain hours in the dining area. This place will continue to take my business until I move out of Tempe.

The prices are great and they have a wonderful happy hour menu as well. The first time we came we got the garlic edamame, best I've ever had! It is soooo good! We get it everytime now. Service is always good and it is hit or miss on how busy they are. I love that on valentine's day every couple got a glowing rose from the owner. Very sweet and thoughtful.

t_eou9y02-jNjry5SYeF9w.text: Second time here. Food is tasty, service is great. Butter corn was perfect. Galbi always is my first choice. We definitely will be back

k55Dos8ZYolq9-tppda51g.text: Do not order pick-up from here, especially if you're viewing their menu online. I'm not from the area and was staying near this restaurant. I called for a pick-up to order based off of the menu on their website. There was a particular item that according to the person on the phone, they don't have anymore. He kept asking what I wanted and I said that I cannot determine that if the menu is not accurate. I asked him if I could just read the description and they could make it, and he said "No, no. What do you want?" I then asked if they had anything similar to that particular roll, which he again repeated that they do not. He kept asking what I wanted and said he was the owner and he was "so sorry" that the menu was not correct. I said respectfully that if he's the owner, he should make sure that the menu online is completely accurate and if items change, that they should be removed or added. It had been a long day and I just wanted to go in and pick up the order, not go in, look at a menu and then sit and wait. He became very combative and continuously asked what I wanted, and I kept repeating that if the menu is showing items they don't have, how could I order? I asked him where to look at an accurate menu and he said "On our website." THAT'S EXACTLY WHERE I WAS LOOKING AND HE TOLD ME PRIOR THAT IT THEY OFTEN HAVE ITEMS THAT CHANGE!! It was a very back and forth conversation for a minute. I told him thank you and hung up, so they lost an order that night. The "owner" according to the man on the phone, made no effort to help or rectify the situation or even say that he would make sure the menu was updated online. He just kept repeating himself and becoming more and more aggressive. It was a very odd conversation, so be careful if you order pick-up. This is not the way to run a restaurant or treat a customer. If your menu changes, you update it. It's that simple. Their online menu is NOT accurate.

W3QiEPdseXOJNgujXLXlIQ.text: Great food, great service! Came here for my first time with my friend for Happy Hour. They had a variety of different appetizers and rolls for their happy hour menu. We decided to get the Bulgogi Hot Pot to split and it was absolutely delicious. It's a big portion, serves easily 2-3 people. They also give you free edamame with a check-in on Yelp as well. I definitely will be coming back to try their other Hot Pots!

yNlP_HpO5epN4y0zU5zGcA.text: I'm always a big fan of asian food, i found this place read a lot of reviews in yelp as i always do. I have ordered spicy garlic tuna, Spicy scallop sushi, spicy salmon roll-all spicy sushi's as i always like. They taste pretty good. Other than that me and my buddy had a signature dish Kkanpungi-Korean style deep fried chicken with sweet spicy marinade taste good.

x0Nb3T0ezWJzSCNV1Z0Bgw.text: Awesome place, reminds me of Japan's traditional izakaya with the variety of appetizers menu. Happy hour menu still has many to choose from.

QtnHT9-VuwBByaQTfVahag.text: I love their food here. They have alot of good options like the Khunpangi and the hot pots. I like that their kitchen closes very late and it makes it an easy choice when going out for late night dining. Their portions are also really good at semi-decent prices.

xseN57nDScpAqmwCwxxT7w.text: The quiet atmosphere (during mid-week early happy hour) was pleasant, and the authentic yakitori (grilled chicken skewers) was just like I had when I lived in Japan.  The salmon sashimi was excellent!  I will be back!  Next time I want try their miso soup and a salad.

VEpPxnn6R8hW-0xXxXYhyQ.text: I very much enjoy this places food. And a bottle of born gold 39 happy hour you cannot beat that. Sami took excellent care of us.

WBSOfNSkPfa8cD2lKz_Ehg.text: We're always on the hunt for new great Asian food in the area. Zu hit the spot for sure! We got the shishito peppers to start--they were in a sauce that was simple, and very tasty. For entres we got the beef bulgogi and Kkanpungi (Korean-style fried chicken with sweet-spicy marinade). The beef bulgogi came out on a sizzling plate which made us even more excited for it. The beef was very tender and flavorful and the veggies were really good with it too. The Kkanpungi was something I had never had before, but can't wait to have it again. The chicken stayed tender and moist on the inside while it stayed crunchy on the outside. The sauce was the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. They also have really good rice--I've been to so many Asian restaurants where the entree is great, but they skimp on the rice so I appreciated the really good bowl of rice from here. We saw a waiter walking by with a hot pot--it looked more like a cauldron(it was so big). We're looking forward to trying a hot pot next.  We told our waiter that it was our first time here and she brought us out a green tea mochi ice cream for dessert, just to say thanks for being a first time customer. It's the little things like that that just make me love a place even more.

GkpB6EmDRPJrBZlSkPlGcQ.text: The sushi was amazing. The vibe is really chill and relaxing. And the wasabi is different and better than any place I've been. I ordered the ebi mayo and shrimp tempura roll. The ebi mayo was real fresh and crispy. The shrimp tempura roll was a lot bigger than expected and tasted great. The prices were pretty reasonable as well.

bwyAPcJXt7zT83NTo2PrHw.text: fantastic place for a happy hour. great service and the hot food was sll really good. we had agedashi tofu, several skewers of yakitori, gyoza, shrimp tempura, and edamame. we just munched away our evening. we also ordered the sashimi omekaze. that was just ok. the yellowtail was really fresh, but the rest was just run of the mill choices, tuna, seared albacore, salmon and ebi. the tako was not very fresh unfortunately. that said, we really enjoyed ourselves in a great atmosphere with fantastic service and ice cold beer. I would stick to the really delicious hot food here. the sushi though not bad was really not great. we absolutely loved our server, Dayae.

6MOXyE7rbVscIvH7CVN1DQ.text: This place is very cozy and has good tofu kimchi soup... It's not on the menu but u should add the soft tofu to the kimchi soup. The portion is pretty big too and can fill 2 people.

CYpJ46BttZ1QGJwJ9s_MFA.text: We love coming to Zu. The food has been fantastic each time. My boyfriend and I ordered the seafood pot the first time and sushi the second time around. They have a great selection of beer and sake to order from as well. The staff is very friendly and we loved our server Semi! Its definitely our new go-to place.

nJ10LPRcSUAohplTAgII0g.text: Been driving past this place for days and was extremely stoked to get gyoza.scope.the menu and.know im coming back with my bros. Sake sake sake

They're a bit fatty, so if you don't enjoy that type of thing... beware! The chicken skewers and veggie egg rolls were also amazing. The service was 10/10. 2Zmj9VykKoRRAMXYbtDjkg.text: A really great, non-sushi Japanese place. I've had the veggie skewers and several of the soups and they are all fantastic.  You can make a meal for two or three out of a single hot pot. I think they have the best seaweed salad I have ever had.

p4TLFC7c2SX7SJ0KgBFBgw.text: When I first visited this restaurant, I realized that I'd been there before, years back. Back then, it was an Italian place, and my husband had taken me there for one of our first dates. It's sad to see a restaurant my husband grew up attending vanish, but I am glad that the building is still here and that such a nice restaurant moved in. The inside has been refurbished to look very elegant and comfortable. Also, the soy sauce containers have adorable cats on them. Obviously a sign of a quality restaurant.   We visited during happy hour and ordered a couple rolls from the happy hour menu. A little more variety on the happy hour menu would be nice, but the rolls were tasty. The spicy salmon was a little spicier than I prefer spicy salmon to be. I didn't try the non-sushi options, which make up a large part of their menu, but I might try them sometime if I am in the area again.

oTt1opUXS2Dj8Uqo8Swb5g.text: Best sushi I have had in a long time! Absolutely loved the vegas roll and My gf ordered the coconut chicken curry. I usually don't like curry but it was delicious! Would definitely recommend to a friend and come back for more.

JA5G1EuaGI-qwzFB5uy6EQ.text: Great food. The Bulgogi and the Veggie eggrolles are bomb. The service is always great. Today James served us. He was very attentive to our needs and provided stellar service!

yikke1Nu1AO6IQl7pQCGZg.text: James took care of me and my friend really well. The food quality was very good too.. definitely a recommended place for late night snacks. Will come back again

m4JEiqtwpG4k6VQTLiq-2Q.text: I am only doing this review for the free ice cream lol but seriously the food is yummy. The garlic edamame is delicious.

l6UpzxGyCUCZztq6leTfwQ.text: Been a couple times now to the restaurant side. Still haven't checked out the bar. I actually didn't even know the bar was there until the last time I went! I was wondering why there was so many cars parked in the lot, but only a few in the restaurant. Anyway to the food. I liked it. The edamame and sushi has always been tasty. They also got some good happy hour specials on food and drinks. It's also a really nice atmosphere and the service has always been great. Definitely worth checking out!

JlPSaBplRql-HFwLnn1A0g.text: Such a cool place to come across! I love that they are open late night. This will be my new after-work spot for food and drinks.

NfigromIsKwla8WVrMymzw.text: Amazing service, amazing food. This is honestly my favorite restaurant in the valley. The chicken curry was incredible!!!! Honestly surprised they're not packed at all times.

1C8n1MO_2_Wg1sQvm2qglA.text: Really great place if you want a good variety. And they have sushi burritos!!! I had been searching for those throughout Scottsdale area and this place had it. Really nice atmosphere as well. Great house sake. Surprised it's not busier here at nights.

HQb12muvuqupRX89BLXIVw.text: This place was EXTRAORDINARY!!!  Wonderful overall experience. First, the staff was great!! Thank you JoJo! Place is clean and service was not only on point but also helpful !!  We had a variety of appetizers!  Can't go wrong with any of them..we had Agedashi Tofu, Butter Corn, Crab Cakes and my personal favorite were the Gyoza!  We had a couple of main dishes but hands down the Bulgogi Mushroom Hot Pot was exceptional!  It is now one of my favorite dishes EVER!! We also had a signature dish called Tofu Kimchi which was fabulous as well. Lots of people around us were having sushi as well and it looked good but we didn't have room for sushi. The servings are plentiful and the pricing, I feel, is on point for what we got. Bottom line...this is a must go to!!

Am8wRX4GyyxilCanx2ZYBw.text: Came in late last night to order takeout grilled chicken with veggies and rice. It smelled amazing in the car ride home, and being very excited to eat it, I expected a lot. When I had my first bite, I became thoroughly disappointed. The quality of the chicken reminded me no more than strip mall quality japanese or possibly airport food. The price was much too high for the quality I received, paying 11 dollars when it should have been 6. I sadly won't be going back.

yW_js_cXrbi9iF-ZId9hfA.text: The Jjanbbong is amazing. I'm consistently surprised by this place. Great service, good atmosphere, and even better food. Venture away from the sushi and try the hot pots. Well worth the price.

Lu5iIFl1R6eLTigHXtNgDQ.text: Waitress JoJo was super sweet and helpful. Love the ambiance. Food was delicious. Highly recommended if you like Japanese food. Prices are totally reasonable as well.

WvpVY6sKNAgMEW7HfAOELg.text: With a location that isn't too difficult to get to, the ambience, interior design, and not importantly food, Zu Izakaya is a great evening dining choice. The food is authentic and the prices match the serving sizes. The menu is appropriately sized so choosing isn't difficult. The selection variety is balanced and will suit all kinds of customer tastes. Highly likely will be visiting another night.

ZKtSGtshv7TXgrUmuml7kw.text: Our server tonight seemed overwhelmed tonight.  When he took our order, my wife told him, " Some people I tell ya"! This was because some folks were complaining about nonsense.  We told him to keep his head up and keep it moving.  Sometimes people complain about price. This place has great food and great prices.  Ask for server Young, his service was outstanding.  See you soon Young.  Vegas!

xqUxpnPnoxUVGk9_U1IahA.text: We just came here for the first time tonight! The spicy kimchi hot pot was so delicious, the chili garlic edamame was cooked perfectly and the bulgogi was tender, delicious and filling. The service was wonderful and the atmosphere was spot on with some fun music. We will definitely come back again!

zQ9B1sdoCEgT0nymW47R4Q.text: We were surprised to find an izakaya place inPhoenix. The menu is a little bit different from what we normally get from an izakaya place but everything we got was good. Liked the poke bowl with salmon and the octopus salad. Fish was fresh and the sauce was delicious. We also got yuki with the meal. Sweet and sour which was a great addition to the meal

anM9Vz5J703sDtu6xMQs7w.text: Delicious meatball skewers!! We came for reverse happy hour and got great deals on sale bombs. Our server JoJo was awesome and we will be back!

hY9B9zDHyAot2hUQLMcaKw.text: old place, that we always come here, like the hot pot best........ but I still need to write a lot of things to finish this review.

_rup3m4CVgeDcP3Y58BsOg.text: A Great Asia restaurant in Phoenix. We were come 11:30pm for dinner, the Chicken wing is beautiful, my son said it is better than KFC. The Udon noodle just right taste like perfect Korea udon. It is surprise have nice Korea food in Arizona.Love it, highly recommended.

ksHoRM43GUf9I0s41HqhOg.text: Amazing food, great prices, awesome staff! Best local sushi I've had in forever! Great environment, chill and fun to come with friends. Also great hours!

uvAm68Jln-aBxuvN5YbWPA.text: The food was fantastic, service was great. The music was a bit too loud as evidenced by the rattling overhead speaker. But - don't let that deter you, the food is totally worth it.

dJCySkxdi7d8V-tYATBp5w.text: The food was amazing as was the service. They have a very big selection of food both sushi and Japanese dishes. I wish their Korean selection was more complete and offered kimchi fried rice and kimchi Chigae, they have soju which made me so Happy!  We will definitely  be back!

FffTdvbWRB8jYqPw-89sbA.text: Nice ambience and generous food portion and do come during happy hours ... for their happy hours menu ...

bVtWaJN3-OYoxCCqWgrdAw.text: The food wasn't really that great. I ordered a ramen with the tonkatsu broth and it was the most tasteless ramen I've ever had. I also ordered the eel and cucumber roll and regretted it. The rice was dry and the cucumber tasted off. The atmosphere was nice. It wasn't too loud or over crowded.

a8u60egrclCOZwCVRuMP8w.text: Actually really impressed with this place. Prices were above average but the food was excellent. I had the unagi tamago bowl and loved it. Will be back for sure.

pQQrYV2_NUk87IuATWU9ag.text: Delicious!!!! I really enjoyed the edamame and the sushi was so fresh!!! The salmon salad was delicious as well!

rsAsHXgBAc8z2JCPcZSJew.text: Great service. Food was quick and tasty. Atmosphere was pleasant.  Expected it to be more busy, but I guess 9:30 isn't prime dining time.

KnWWpAf8Txc0Xq3DFy-keA.text: Amazing food! Great ambiance! Great service! Manami was our server and she was outstandingly helpful. Visiting from Cali, craving sushi, but not knowing what we quite wanted . . . Manami helped us figure out what we wanted and had us leaving deeply satisfied with our meal and the service. Recommend to anyone craving sushi and visiting here in Phoenix, Arizona.

79q-xPd35hDP3BnVxvyM-Q.text: Fantastic sushi! Service was great and the food was awesome. The happy hour menu wasn't to shabby, either.

aJgc4lWtycN7SAK7jQMfeg.text: Stopped by for Friday night dinner, and luckily it wasn't too crowded. My waitress was very very nice and guided me through the menu. I ordered from the happy hour and the dinner menus. Spicy tuna roll, naughty lemonade, and pork galbi dish were great. My favorite of course was the main dish (grilled meat + rice, can't go wrong). The sake was good, but I thought the 'naughty lemonade' was a cocktail so I couldn't finish my sake alone. The spicy tuna was a little on the salty side, so it tasted better without the soy sauce. The pork was wonderful, I was split between that and the bulgogi. I think I made a great decision either way. I would have loved to try the hot pot too but I was quite full after the items I ordered. I would definitely come back with friends next time I'm in the area! Seems like a great restaurant for larger groups.

VOTrhR5mZxepC2SJDTjbvQ.text: A few friends and I decided to grab some sushi for dinner tonight and ended up here. The food was fresh and  and I'm not a huge sushi fan, so it surprised me! The spicy pork is what we ordered and it was delicious. The music was on point and the atmosphere was great also. Jojo was our server and she was so personable and we will definitely be back because of how great the service was. She was dope! We will be back. Will definitely recommend this place from now on!! It's a hidden gem

_1C0tn8LVcQL-IkMB_JVjA.text: My husband and I had flew in late at night and were feeling hungry after hauling luggages around all day; we searched for a non-fast food join and were lucky to have found this place that was open until 2am!! Great service, amazing portions, and quality food!!!!! Perfect place for drinks or for just a nice intimate meal. 10/10 would come back and recommend to everyone.

6KC22g3-tqQrtHwPakProg.text: The service was really good! Had such a great dinner. The food was well presented beautifully. Everything tasted delicious. I'm really pleased with this place overall and would highly recommend it to anyone in the area.

7rdHxYPX5yy93BU4NOSwEQ.text: Spicy Pork is amazing. Sushi was excellent. Meatball skewers are a must try. I know sounds crazy but the iced green tea was so good. I am obsessed with it.

3fCkHYdI4_R5nV58DIWqYQ.text: Everything was wonderful. I'm new to the seafood liking, but they had some great stuff. A seafood soup that I had for the first time (YUM) and of course, fresh tuna rolls were bomb. They had a wide selection of sake too.

4aO0nAVA3WmPVrxYD751Bg.text: While it says izakaya which is traditionally Japanese, there is definitely strong Korean influences on the menu, service was a bit lackluster.  Jumped between the happy hour (ends at 7 PM) and regular menu, the star of the show in terms of taste was the Bulgogi Mushroom Hot Pot.  Wide range of sake and soju, but no craft beers on the menu ... what a shame!

GlGT7QHAL2UosT-wEg49_A.text: Food is superb... would like to come back here with a DD so we can try the food with Soju...  hubby really likes the fresh wasabe...  you should try it if you really like it SPICY... they should add side dishes to the korean dishes though but overall great food!!!

fDT9UbXsvdTGyVZq7noGug.text: The sushi is always amazing and happy hour is good..  Love to come here and eat quality sushi Everytime

5Lrni7NY2jlZKPXRuoZRWw.text: Tofu bowl yum spicy roll are all good jalapeno roll is the bomb, they due a great chicken bowl for the kids too

Hv0qP_yVTG6yEAgZcmGnNw.text: Went here for my three year anniversary in October. Ordered sake bombs, flavored sake, crab cakes, cheese spam katsu, black mussel hot pot with udon noodles, and some sushi rolls. Everything was awesome! The hot pot was amazing. Big enough for two people or leftovers. Would be really great if you're sick and they deliver through doordash or Postmates. Can't remember which, they had a sign. Would definitely recommend!

PbGo_vZHOaacEdi4sq_3bw.text: Better than Top Ramen. Their playlist was straight fire the whole night. Las Vegas roll was astounding and the Zu Poke Bowl changed my life. Service was kinda lacking until we ordered and then she was on top of it. Miso soup was above par. The other rolls we got we really good too.

jTyfbolgm_KXbpDWNZIMCg.text: Las Vegas roll  Poke bowl with tuna  Agedashi tofu a little stiff but good and crispy Chicken and pork skewers  Spicy tuna roll   Hostess is very friendly  Went to this place while happy hour from 9-11pm on a Friday's night and it's dead but great food!   So full!  Will come back again if I'm in the area

9Hi9RbzqUHaHLAfIJi5eVA.text: The service was fast and the food was delicious! Thanks to our wonderful server James.

hXbU5G9QfbA4dQxzWsOA1Q.text: Well, this place has worst short rib and ramen. The short rib was so tough you cant barely chew it. The ramen aren't actually ramen more likely cup noodle ramen, that you can get it from any Asian grocery.

WnnD9FKMZRmUU3nuKDNY9Q.text: Been driving by quite a few time and wanting to try since moving here from Vegas. This place is definitely on par with the other Ozakaya place that I've been to. Everything was excellent so was the service.  If you are a fan of Izakaya,  then this place is a must try .

fRcM6H5jDBVpu7kUNdU21A.text: All those 5 starts for the mirin mackerel all the way! Very flavorful and deliciously done. The shishito peppers had an amazing kick to them. The eggdrop Seafood soup was a little on the milder side but tasted good while it was hot. Good ambiance and Best part is that they are open till 1am on a weekday !! Loved it.

8GiT0uIKtqVXAldG2wuTnA.text: I went with my boyfriend and was told it was happy hour all day if we went to their separate adjacent bar. We decided to try it out and were definitely pleased with the food selection and cheap drinks. We ordered $5 gyoza, $6 sushi, and shared a bulgogi hot pot. I liked the gyoza and sushi but was not so excited about the hot pot. I've had hot pot and made a version myself and loved it.  The liquid had an odd taste to me and I wish the restaurant had Korean sauces to offer because it was bland. Also, there was only one employee serving the whole bar so service was friendly but slow. That said, I'd come back and order other things and look forward to it.

QNW_llhab7WXH6gjGa5xGA.text: Amazing place .. Must haves are. Cheese corn, Gyoza, chili garlic edamame & spam katsu

N37oX1YmvKlAVBN_9mocWA.text: Amazing sushi restaurant with great staff. They also have other options if you are not a fan of sushi itself. This is my favorite place to go! I highly recommend the Las Vegas roll.

VMgF5z1mbiADSngwp4uVOA.text: Great service! My friends and I went here to wind down after a long day of work. Our bartender Kevin was awesome, this place has a great vibe to it.

t6m6ubKBna6VCEGiHCkrxQ.text: Found this place on a whim after work late one night. Got there at midnight and they stay open until 1 am on weeknights. We ordered the gyoza, crab cakes, and the garlic edamame to start and bulgogi and tuna tataki salad     Everything that we ordered, EVERYTHING was fresh, hot, and absolutely delicious! Our server was amazing and very friendly. In addition to the amazing food they are one of the only places that carries Orion beer in AZ. You won't be sorry if you decide to come by late night. I will definitely be back!

mscZE-s-P_Y8ZFq7QYA1FQ.text: Imagine plate after gorgeous plate of delicious Asian apps and entrees. Our party of five started out with sake & soju all around. The crisp apple soju was a sweet treat, but the unfiltered pear was even better. We started out with a few typical choices - edamame, bbq pork and chicken skewers, and delicate veggie tempura. Then we wandered through a zesty squid salad and fresh seaweed salad, both were terrific. We loved the crispy gyoza dumplings, the incredibly flavorful tuna tartare, and the udon noodles flavored with zucchini and beef, and finally the spicy fried chicken. Every single dish was perfectly prepared, delivered graciously, and so so good. I cannot wait to get back here and try a few more items on the menu. We were too early for their sushi menu, but it looked pretty good too. Loved it Loved it Loved it.

Uootgek0m3NCe1qxWG7eeA.text: Gyoza was delicious. Favorite thing we had was the guachajong salmon - perfect spice level and not heavy at all.  Plays too much emotional, breakup songs over the stereo system. Buzz kill.

vgzzRjELw8DfIJ3KahoJzw.text: So delicious!! We ordered a hot pot and a few sushi rolls and shared family style. It's worth it to try several different things! Our waitress, Min, was also super friendly and gave us great recommendations!

TCCXaZ1vOlTprQ5L7yPmEg.text: Place is great. Good atmosphere good food what more can you ask for. Open late for that late night smack after a show.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Waiting for some awesome food

iHKK1o2ZhQOgmsvVBgXNOw.text: We came in for the happy hour and it did not dissapoint. Decent select for happy hour and it goes till 7! Good service and food came out very fast. None of us had been here before and we would certainly come back.   There is plenty of parking and easy to get to. Also, they have some poppin music is you don't mind it. Not too loud that you need earplugs.

Q7-YLH7CBKuXU424Ia7nvA.text: Just had the most amazing Japanese food. I ordered a good bowl of chicken Thai curry hotpot - super delicious and super sufficing.  Tip: One bowl of hot pot is more than enough for three people.

rTKh5yKup2elPCrkl_BdhQ.text: The decorations are great, good is fabulous, staff is very friendly and I would definitely come back and recommend to others! So yummy!

Il_l9f0L7JXoat9ZeoKAYQ.text: I live in the neighborhood and was surprised to suddenly see the old Italian restaurant that had been there forever replaced with this rather interesting new option.  Decided to check it out when my wife had some friends for dinner and I needed a break - so glad I did and will definitely be back.  Very friendly staff and the interior redesign/redecorate is comfortable and relaxing.  Tried a small bottle of sake which was very good - I've not been exposed to this too much so it was interesting to try - they have a decent selection and bottles are 50% off during happy hour.  They serve a variety of small dishes - I had the quail eggs which were so tasty and a chicken skewer dish and edamame both of which were also very good.  I finished up with the squid legs which were fine, but probably won't have them again. Overall a very enjoyable experience with interesting food options and a relaxed and friendly ambience.

eWSqSWt6fetjdGsYMSPN9Q.text: I enjoyed myself and we all liked or meals. waitress was GREAT. she was new and charming. I forgot her name. I have to give only 4* because their oden was not up to par. there were no veggies. no konbu no egg no tofu no konyaku no daikon nothing except one potato. there was only fishcake varieties. the other dishes were good except this.

5ye3jrpmZlXPuARhJ1gx7w.text: just sat down. haven't tried the food yet but the ambience is quite nice. will update later with food review

AT_MUoH8B2612JI2pbUAOw.text: Honestly I'm surprised by all of the good reviews for this place. My bf and I decided to give this a place a try since it's fairly new to the neighborhood, and it was the most bizarre dining experience that either one of us have ever had. Our server was nice.... But the menu... I shudder a little just thinking about it. It had everything on it from a quesadilla to ketchup covered spam. Not being totally scared off after viewing the menu, we decided to order several things to give it a try. We ordered some steak kabobs and chicken skewers to start. The steak kabob was neither a steak nor a kabob. What was brought to us was a hamburger patty covered in what appeared to be teriyaki sauce with a little wooden fork stuck in the middle. Again, it was a hamburger patty.... and didn't taste like a very good quality one either. Feeling adventurous we pressed on and tried the chicken skewers. These didn't taste bad, but were definitely the gristly parts of a chicken that you wouldn't normally want to eat. Unfortunately we had already put in an order for an entree, we even were talking about just asking for the bill and canceling the entree, but right as we were going to ask for the check, our food came out of the kitchen. This is the ONE instance where I wish the service had been terrible and the wait long. But unfortunately, like I already stated, the wait staff was great. Stuck at this point, we faced our entree (which was one of their signature dishes, the Kkanpungi). We both hesitantly dug in, and were mildly surprised. The chicken quality was better than the skewers we had already had and the flavor wasn't terrible. It was coated in layer after layer of sugary sweet sauce though, and we could only eat a couple pieces each before we threw in the towel, asked for the check, and promised each other we would never come back to this place and ONLY recommend it to our mortal enemies.

9SJThmc2KtNkaJAfscC3ew.text: Came here a few months ago and my date and I both got food poisoning. I came here again tonight and received really awful service. I ordered some stuff for here including a hot house sake and some things to go. Waited 10 minutes and still hadn't received my hot sake. Server was very rude and not communicative when I asked questions. Not to mention I'm sitting outside with my dog waiting for my hot miso and sake to warm me up. I confront my server about my service and ask her if she's okay because I work in the industry myself. I know what it's like to have off days. No apology. Just blames me for canceling my sake, miso, and edamame because I've been waiting 10 minutes for it. As soon as I bring up the fact that I've been waiting for 10 minutes for my drink and that I'm upset about it, she responds with "you cancelled it". I said "yes but I ordered it as soon as I sat down..." trying to explain I cancelled my "for here" order because it was taking so long and I thought my to go was about to be ready. She then asks "well do you have your ID?" I said "yes! Why didn't you ask for it when I first ordered?" I just get a dumbfounded look, hand her my ID, and she's back in 5 seconds with my sake. Worst service I have ever received and I was nothing but polite about it. Elisa just made me feel like complete garbage and I don't like dining at places that don't value my hard earned money that is supporting their lives...

deZPpPvuu_re2cRctN2gyw.text: The Jalapeno Vegas Roll on their happy hour is fantastic! I came here on a recommendation and I couldn't be happier. Can't wait to come back and try more!

gUA__w0tuFVeM9htRtNpxA.text: I'm terribly angry and disappointed in this place. I had a curry chicken hot pot which was fine but I specifically asked the bartender if they could do a vegetarian hot pot or anything really for my girlfriend which I was going to get to go since she wasn't with me. He came back and said that they could do my same dish without the chicken. I SPECIFICALLY asked if the broth was vegetarian to which he replied YES.  I tried the broth from the "vegetarian" to go order once I got to my car and it tasted the same as the meat one I had in the restaurant. I grew up working in restaurants thus I consider myself decent with distinguishing flavors. Well, I gave him the benefit of the doubt initially but on the way home I thought I should double check so I called them. I was told the broth is a pork broth and that the can't even be made vegetarian! Well I'm 20 min away now and fuming because not only is my gf vegetarian but she's allergic to pork! Luckily I took the extra measure to check. This is absolutely UNACCEPTABLE especially to someone who worked in the industry for several years and who has a gf with a severe allergy. On top of that I was never offered water and they also forgot my appetizer. Even when I called the girl who answered wasn't even apologetic. They need to train their staff better or they will be liable if someone did have an allergic reaction.

jY3l4wmrSdsP5HUDUZMNzg.text: I love the Zu (said, "zoo)! As with many sushi places, if you can make it in for happy hour then you can score some serious deals. My personal favorites are the chicken skewers and spicy edamame. Honestly, the spicy edamame is the best - the sushi is almost a downgrade believe it or not!   But that isn't to say that the sushi is bad. It is just that the spicy edamame is just so good! I've tried Zu's signature and basic rolls. Haven't been disappointed yet. Fiance is a vegetarian and she likes their selection as well.   Staff is very attentive regardless of where you sit. My water glass was refilled every time it got half-way. That is some service! Food came out fast whether it was a app, basic, tempura, or signature. Haven't tried anything off the min menu so I can't comment on it.  Check in on Yelp for some goodies.

pKaABjxVkPjka6cvQtOZZA.text: Had hot pot and a few entrees.  Food was tasty!  Service was pretty good.  Music on the restaurant side was terrible.  Please fix the music, it was so cheesy and lame.

qGhzVkGyVXlPhaC_f3E7CA.text: Try the banana Japanese wine! Yum! Egg rolls, tempura were delicious and great prices.

lwPnwtcpYRzfT5pHUtkmfQ.text: Made an online order and it was one of the easiest things I've done lol even more simple than callin it in, so it's super cool that they offer this option! The veggie tempura was really good; fairly close to actual Japanese tempura so that was a nice surprise to me. The spicy salmon and tuna hand roll were average; pretty good but nothing AMAZING. One thing I hated was the to-go spy sauce they give. I've been here to dine in and the soy sauce was good but the carry out soy sauce kind of ruined the sushi for me.  I still like it for it's late hours and quick service and will be returning. The soy sauce is just a minor point ;)

fA4QA9fZ2fN8rAG6CPdlGg.text: So first glance, neat place! Great happy hour specials, and the vibe is good, not your typical sushi/Asian joint. It's more modernized and laid back.  Food wise, everything was on point. Sushi was on par with standard, good quality sushi. I got the Bolgogi grill and it was flavorful and juicy. Rice was standard but good and moist. They provided one type of soy sauce and it seemed to be low sodium so that was great, also it was a better quality than most standard sushi restaurants. For sushi I got the seared albacore and onion roll and the flavors meshed perfectly!   Staff wise, they were on point, quick with ordering and keeping up with everything. No complaints!  All in all, I'd come back! This place is open late and a great dive! Definitely on my travel food list!

Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

V_jjVOZNEylq-BJCPOIfSw.text: Come here at the weekend night,we tried the Kikusui Junmai Ginjo,good peach flavor soju!foods are good here,and the chinese waiter Ken is really handsome!!

fL6asBbp1XnwHrsMDL6aWQ.text: I can't count the amount of times my boyfriend and I have came here to eat. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I've tried having something different every time I come and each thing has been absolutely delicious. Seriously, you can't go wrong with whatever you choose (even the spam grilled cheese! So good!). Great portions, staff, atmosphere, music, and always super clean. 11/10 recommend! Enjoy!

iaZSWr0L79ixb0GZ-YLbng.text: The place is a gem. I was a bit reluctant to order sushi but when it tried it.. it was fresh.. I also ordered Thai curry chicken pot... refreshingly good!

kVLaqTEByWDaHhSIDg-GUw.text: Gurllllllllll! Give Jojo a raise. She's a freaking bop! 100/10. On a bad day. Would recommend! She's great! Did I mention she's great?

zAkOf_oXdkLVx7_p8oXyKA.text: Friendly service! A little strange to have Disney songs in the background, but dim lighting gives the place a nice feel. Food was decent. Didn't get a hot pot today but have in the past and they're super good and big enough for two people!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

hQXUDnzFmorl2jkFigwGiw.text: Tempe Yelpers let me down again! I've had this place bookmarked for a long time and we finally got to try it last Friday night. We got there right as happy hour was ending and the sushi bar was closing. Ordered some chicken, meatball, and sausage skewers first. The meatballs resembled the swedish meatballs from IKEA and the sausages were legit the Cheddar Lil Smokies from the grocery store. I couldn't believe it. I also ordered the seafood yaki udon and it was smothered in sauce and so sweet I couldn't even finish it. My boyfriend ordered a couple of the other skewers too but they were just so small and all tasted like they were marinaded in the same terriyaki sauce, not worth the price. So disappointing.

v7a3vOuLwr5hEe1I1KU02w.text: I absolutely loved this place! I am such a critic when it comes to good food especially Asian. I think I am spoiled because I am from San Francisco and there are so many good places to eat. Well this was quite a find. Korean, Japanese and they even have some fusion dishes. I had the spicy pork and it was amazing. I will be back this week.

ugAgrFNeeuBlhjFLj6a4dQ.text: Came here for dinner with my friends.  We wanted to try the hot pot.  The place is nice, clean, and modern decor feel to it.  Service was good but a tad slow.  Ordered and inhaled:  1.  Agedashi Tofu - It was pretty good, could have a crispier outside 2.  Chicken & Neobiani Steak Skewer - Both skewers were good 3.  Pork Gyoza Pot - Japanese tonkotsu soup base pot with pork gyoza, egg, clear noodle, and assorted vegetable - I think it would have been been if I traded for udon noodles.  I love udon.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pork gyoza hot pot

Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Agedashi Tofu

f3ArTjDRrRlwLlucsabOcg.text: I have been to many Izakaya's before. The food is not bad. Just kind of pricey in my opinion. It's supposed to be where you get off work, order a few things and drink. But these items are quite expensive and it becomes more than a full cost of a meal.  The meat kabob was like a hamburger meat. One small round piece. I was expecting steak meat. Or at least something bigger.  The poke rice bowl looked appetizing however. Will have to try next time if not on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Neobiani steak. $2.5 during happy hour.

ByI9DLOgfdWk8H3u336vig.text: This place is in a great location on the border of Tempe and Scottsdale. Great food and great prices! Love how the bar and the dining area are separated, it's a unique feature that more places should do. Overall, I really recommend it!

VfOjX0JyWfdiFw3MV_pMEA.text: Great place to grab a late bite and drinks. Good happy hour selections of appetizers and sushi tools till 11pm.

BwLBhfaUS9KXQVMEVGa_Yg.text: I love coming here for happy hour! Their prices is so affordable especially for happy hour for sushi! Their sushi is pretty fresh for the price and their appetizers is amazing. Oh and their soups is good too!

m-zph4mAWjzgJ53dkjfaYg.text: Hadn't had sushi in a few months and was craving it. Took my gf here for her bday. Was really excited because the reviews of this place were pretty impressive. I feel our experience could've been a bit better if our server was a little more knowledgeable about some of the questions we had asked.  For this I removed 1 star. If you don't know what something is, tell the customer you'll find out not oh,  I wish I knew and then wait. Anyways, aside from this, the food was perfect. Everything tasted great, fresh, and very nice presentation. Place has a very cool vibe and the staff was helping one another which is cool to see. Our server was nice, seemed a bit too busy though maybe a bit understaffed that night not sure. In any case we will return again. I really enjoyed it and love that they have some vegetarian rolls available as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. In &amp; out roll, spicy tuna &amp; sweet potato roll

Ansqb2SIX3OtFcMngCXcWA.text: On a sushi kick lately, this is my second time here and I have to say, I'm impressed.   Staff is very friendly, and I was greeted and sat quickly. They have a nice seating area inside that boasts a bar and dining experience, plus an outside patio to enjoy this beautiful weather we are having.   Happy Hour specials are the way to go. 3-7pm on weekdays. Better bang for your buck. They have a large list of appetizers, highly recommend the Spam cheese fries, any of the skewers or wings.   Hot pots are amazing, large portions and they come in these cool black cast iron pots.   The ringer of the whole place, their sushi rolls. These are some of the best I've had so far in the valley. Try the Jalapeno Vegas Roll, you won't be disappointed. Pair it with a saki bomb or iced green tea, and you'll be set.

This place is a korean-Japanese fushion restaurant & has a great variety of both Japanese and korean dishes.   The service is so great! We asked for extra sauces and they were so kind to us!   Overall a really good place and definitely checking it out again!   Order: I got the Spicy Salmon sushi roll, the Spicy Poke bowl, and a Soju bomb, with Cass.

We had 6 dishes in total and they were very good. I would especially recommend the Kani cucumber  or anything with the word "spicy" in front of it because it actually is spicy, compared to other places that lack that.

AvWAXrsJiGVc51EM4CQWYA.text: My boyfriend friend and I come to ZuLzakaya all the time! Their happy hour is amazing and convenient. Great prices, friendly staff! I couldn't recommend this place enough. The garlic edamame is reason enough to come! Love it!!

WtxAyMLLTpS9QIpLR4wNLw.text: I was here a few days ago and everything was awesome. Took a friend because this a Japanese spot was referred to me. I had the Korean fried chicken which was just unbelievably great. Service was also good. The atmosphere was relaxed and chill.   And the price was not to bad either. We got in and out for under $50.00.   Will definitely be coming back again. This place was a winner.

c7PdYY-H5VzqO4j85CrETw.text: Met a couple of my friends here for some sushi and some Asian. I never really heard of this place before but you know why not right? So I walk in and I was really pleasantly surprised because it was quite nice inside and once I join my friends and had a few bites of sushi I knew this was going to be a winner. Of course I had a tuna roll which is my favorite and it was as good as it gets. Everything was fresh even the rice was good.  My only gripe would've been that the service was a little slow but the sushi was so good that I really didn't pay much attention to that. Check this place out. It's a real winner and you'll love the sushi.

E6EdwYfoxKj0MMmWTPWdoQ.text: Salmon sashimi taste like salmon sashimi which is a good thing! Joke aside, we ordered lolipop roll, banzai roll, a hot pot soup that I forgot the name of and garlic edamame. Tbe sushi taste good, i especially like the lolipop roll, edamane was delicious and the hot pot soup was delicious and inexpensive. Service is awesome and if you come during happy hour you can get a sake bomb that cist $7 dollars but come with a 1 pint 6 oz beer and a hot sake that is decently size. Overall a very good sushi place.

rthF7U_v4_9vWPWnncrw_w.text: This is STRICTLY for the bar side of the restaurant. My husband and I sat in the bar area for the first time the other night and we were SO disappointed. It felt like a completely different atmosphere. Our waitress was also the bartender, and the room was full. She wasn't very attentive and we did end up ordering through on of our favorite waitresses.   The menus were discolored and cracked, there were very dirty areas of the restaurant and we both agreed that this did not seem like a bar area. There weren't many tables, and the restrooms were right by our seats. We ordered Asahi and drank it straight from the bottles because of how dirty our glasses were.   The back door to leave, opens up right to a gate which goes the opposite way - which felt so odd. The whole vibe felt like a completely different restaurant, and not like the feeling we normally experience while here.   Our food as always was great which was the saving grace of our night. I would recommend this restaurant ONLY if you sit in the front half of the building. It truly was a disappointing experience sitting in the bar, and not the main room.

eU3sdWVvdQeJb_Qr5y1n-Q.text: Great happy hour!! I always leave super full with yummie food. And I love the karaoke :)

Ex2r2EK7T6dBPtSEkzAIDA.text: Looking for delicious food and marvelous value? This is it! The Happy Hour menu at Zu Izakaya is extensive, well thought out, and makes you want to try everything! Which we have. Add to that, the alcohol factor, and you've hit the mark!   The customer service is well done and further enhanced by Miss Leah and James. They are forever checking on tables making sure everyone is well cared for and happy. A complete win win! Great food and fantastic service.  It's our new favorite place to have drink(s) and woof down some eats with friends. The value is pretty incredible.  Here's the lowdown on our orders:  *Junmai Sake- please see photo, speaks for itself *Sapporo draft beer! Cheer's! *Edamame- would order this even if it was not free with Yelp-checkin. Fried Calamari- Total 5 stars! Fried perfectly and with paprika dusting makes for fabulous food while drinking. *Shishito Peppers- love the broth they sit in. I secretly use it for the fried calamari ;) *Agedashi Tofu- soft tofu fried then served in a sauce lending itself to be delish!  *Spicy Tuna roll loaded with a well done tuna filling *Yellowtail spicy roll also with a nice kick and flavor *Yellowtail Sushi( just look at the colors pop!) *Salmon  Sushi-please see photos of splendorous colors! Altogether makes for a relaxing wonderful evening with friends Joyce W. and Michael W. who live to enjoy!   They have a large parking lot attached so parking has never been an issue. Try it out and see how you like this place. As always, Thanks for reading!
