vp9bbqg8oRLe9Q7A347WnQ.text: On the average Wednesday, I would be cooking dinner. But, today we decided to treat ourselves. And treat ourselves we did. I ordered the tonkatsu with curry, my wife ordered the spicy crab roll, and we had a salmon Kama between us.   The tonkatsu: I do not really eat pork outside of the barbecue form, but oh em gee will I house some tonkatsu. It was crispy, crunchy, and outrageously juicy by itself. But, once you dip it in the sauce...divine. The curry was superb as well. It was rich. It was thick. Dayum, it was thicc. And it was exactly what I needed to fuel my fight through the rest of the week.   The spicy crab roll: I did not partake because I had copious amounts of breaded pork and curry to consume, but my wife said it was good. Good did not suffice, so I asked her to be a bit more eloquent. She went to dinner after several hours of studying and her brain was thoroughly frazzled. For her, the crab roll was a nostalgia-inducing experience. It reminds her of her favorite sushi place back home. She is now fully energized with the right amount of heat and crab meat to assault her work.  The salmon Kama: This was the unexpected star. We decided on this interesting piece of salmon cheek instead of the go-to gyoza. Holy mackerel, was this mind-blowing. It's a delicious slab of salmon with grill marks on it. We tore in to just the flesh, then added some lemon juice, then dipped some in the magical sauce that came with it, and each resulted in mutual mmmphermagerdmmm's being exchanged between us. At one point I proclaimed that I wanted to return and order four of these for myself.  If you are on the fence, come here. Eat. Be happy. Leave content with life.

04rwi0cyfGEFWxCvDFb3kA.text: Great asian food restaurant.  I ordered the vegetable tempura, which was excellent.  Light crispy fresh vegetables.  The pineapple  soju was amazing, honestly one of the best drinks I've ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegetable Tempura, edamame, pineapple  soju

7NAnJV7CS9zHXuCsP1_ACQ.text: Elisa was awesome! Great bar area is just as nice as the restaurant and has the benefit of a solid happy hour menu. All the food we had didn't disappoint  and I appreciated the guidance on the sake  menu since we don't know anything about sake. So jealous of my friends that live right next door!

6EXjYr0Uzk_bCIFBsCC3hg.text: This is going to start out awkwardly. J promised some guests that we would have bulgogi beef at Thanksgiving. I, being the hostess, now have to find cooked, takeout bulgogi. For crying out loud! I suggested getting the meat raw from Mekong and grilling. This would not stand. I am left calling around to Korean BBQ places across the east valley. Each thought I was kidding. Takeout bulgogi! Blasphemous!   Enter Yelp. I am happy to find that Zu Izakaya has it to go, and is basically across the street from my work. Add the ability to order online,  and I'm sold!  I placed an order for 4 bulgogi, and then a slew of items to try for dinner that night. I ordered: cheese spam katsu, squid legs, udon noodles and soft shell crab.   Walking in, the restaurant was quiet and dark. It was very relaxed, with calm decor. I did wait quite a while at the reception to be noticed. My food was given without issue, and was prepared at the designated time. The gentleman seemed appreciative of my business.  The squid legs (tentacles) were a bit chewy and salty, but overall ok. The spam was an experimental purchase. Very good, but weird. The cheese was like Velveeta, so the texture got me. The udon was lovely. Too much devil apple (onion) for me, but I fed them to J. The soft shell crab was the beat part. Crunchy yet perfect inside. I really enjoyed it. The bulgogi was a hit on Turkey Day. I reheated covered in the oven, and it was perfect.  I will visit Zu Izakaya again.

hghLrGpq7ueXpZztVcq3OA.text: Service was good. We did have to wait a bit for someone to greet us. It was slower so understandable. Our waitress frequently stopped by to check on us and waters always filled.   Food was mediocre. We ordered chicken, pork, and steak skewers. The sauce tasted the same for all so it was disappointing. I was hoping for more variety. We also ordered Korean fried chicken. It was drenched in sauce and blah. We ate less than half and decided not to take it home. Our waitress was nice and asked us if we didn't enjoy it. She managed to get us a discount. Good effort on service once again.   Ambiance is nice and modern. Unfortunately, food wasn't as exciting as other yelpers made it to be.  Sad face!!

I've only sat in the back bar area on Saturday nights and the cheap Sapporo, diverse sake menu, and silly karaoke make for great fun :)

pLCV0lANk4ieWiJjRiROUQ.text: Delicious! This place is amazing! Obviously went her cuz the reviews were high and I was hoping for the best. They did not disappoint! Had a variety of different sushi, all were so fresh and good!

642bN0jbOiDIOVHBP6SeJQ.text: I've come here twice and have thoroughly enjoyed each time I've been here.   There is a private lot with a good amount of parking. The location itself has plenty of Seating and is welcoming to couples or larger groups.   The service has always been prompt and friendly. I've never had to wait for a beverage or a plate. If and when things are running a little slow, they are quick to disclose and let you know (in this instance we got there right at 4 and the sushi chef wasn't in, but it didn't matter as we got our dish quickly anyways-- I appreciated them letting me know).   They have a FAB HH and everything had been fresh and well seasoned. I was hesitant to order to the sushi burrito, but my friend April S had it before and made sure we got it.  It wAs a giant roll in rice paper full of delish raw tuna and salmon amount other flavors that provided a great contrast of both flavors and textures.   They offer good drink specials as well. I had a few drafts and them tried the pineapple sujo... It was delish!   Try this place out before going to a chain restaurant. You'll be glad you did!

Spicy. But not crazy spicy. Loaded with flavor. Only 2 shrimp. However loaded with everything else!  I seriously could not stop eating it!  You could enjoy all the seafood but the broth did not have an overwhelming seafood base. Just right I would say. Also had a happy hour item. A poke bowl. It was good. Had it with salmon. A little lite in the salmon. Seemed a little too much sesame oil flavor. However over all it was good!  There is a wide selection of udon soup, hot pots, sushi, salads Etc. great variety. Service was wonderful. Lots of parking.

51fPFip3kdG8t7JICxNfPw.text: I am not too fond of their sushi as I have had better elsewhere. Their entree and appetizer menu though is amazing. My favorite items to recommend are the Spam Musubi and Mozzarella Sticks. For dessert the Mochi Ice cream is great. I always come here after work and have a late night snack. They also have karaoke in the bar area which everyone loves to do.

jjMggaGD9y87XKID5awbIw.text: Zu Izakaya offers a nice variety of Japanese, Korean, and fusion dishes in small bites or main entrees. We came here right before happy hour ended at 7 which allowed us to indulge in some discounted dishes such as the poke bowl, sushi burrito, agedashi tofu and chicken skewers. We also ordered a few selections from the main menu. This included small bites like asparagus, quail egg, cheese Spam katsu, and meatball skewers. The only larger meal we ordered (Aside from the happy hour poke bowl) was the freshwater eel.  My favorites were the poke and eel. The poke was very fresh, with a deep rich red color, and a good amount of seasoning. The bowl came with rice, nori strips, seaweed, and crab salad. The eel was a beautiful presentation with tender eel, sweet sauce, and vegetables on the bottom. A more unique dish was the "sushi burrito" which was basically a modified roll with ingredients like spicy tuna, tamago and crab salad, wrapped in soy paper and cut into 2 like you would cut a burrito in half.  I wasn't as big of a fan of the cheese Spam katsu. The gooey melted cheese was similar to Velveeta and it was way too salty combined with the Spam. I did like the crispy crunch of the breading, but maybe some sweet sauce or a different cheese with the katsu would balance out the flavors more.  When we were seated and ready to order my server took down my friends' orders and then walked away. We had to exclaim to her loudly "Wait come back" for her to actually take my order down. There seemed to be a miscommunication about the amount of food we wanted to order but instead of apologizing she had an attitude about it, like it wasn't her fault she decided to leave a customer hanging without taking down their order. Service was better as the meal continued though and drinks were refilled and plates taken away as needed.  Service could use an attitude adjustment, but I'll be back to try more dishes.

I ordered some Korea style seafood soup, on the menu key words are: sea food, pork, and ramen. When it was served, I was totally disappointed. Ramen? Seriously? It was just fast noodle! And I swear the soup tasted totally same as Nongshim fast noodle, you know the one is sold for only $2 in supermarket. And they just added very few seafood, some chopped pork and mushrooms, onions, that'll. I did not miss anything. THAT'S ALL. If you go to any Japanese ramen restaurant, at least they would use pork bone and cooked for ten hours. But this? It's just chopped pork. And can you believe they charged $16.95 for this fast noodle soup! Worst place.

8WxBI6N4d-5Cn3gWpcKlLQ.text: I went here for happy hour. This is one of the best sushi restaurants in town. The food quality is amazing. The salmon was very fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this place. Everything looked very nice. I will be back

ATEYaALDTlBV6LFbFvLG9A.text: We had chili garlic edamame, albacore ceviche, scallop dynamite, and bulgogi mushroom pot. The dishes were creative, fun, and original, but also delicious, and the price was great.   Chili garlic edamame: the regular edamame you would expect, but in a slightly spicy garlig sauce. A little bit salty but may balance the relatively light flavored dishes depending on what else you order.  Albacore ceviche: five stars. The fish was fresh. A lot of onions in the pico de gallo on top which added to the refreshing taste.  Scallop dynamite: seafood and veggies roasted with cheese. Not the typical food you would expect in an Asian resturant, but it was well executed. Surprise in a good way.  Bulgogi mushroom pot: normal hot pot.  Service was great. We dined at the bar. The guy at the bar was very friendly and caring for his customers.

bY3rdLjplmQE7CfRNtAOvA.text: Visiting Scottsdale, we found this cool sushi place! It is something of a Korean/Japanese fusion. Very well done. We have had sushi all over California and Arizona, and have yet to find an equal to flavor freshness to and taste! The tempura was light and crispy, and the sushi was beyond fresh! Not to mention we were surprised at a second happy hour, they are open till one in the morning and we happen to come in at nine for their second happy hour! That's right, two happy hours! Can you believe it?? I cannot believe the great prices and the freshness as well as the amazing service. I even gave us free edamame :-) Friendly staff, And attentive wait staff. We will definitely come back to this place on vacation! We are so excited to have found this gem we are here for a few more days, and I am thinking we may have dinner here again tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

kau4Q4eEGtZmN10_PPLjNA.text: Full disclosure....Im only halfway through my meal. I am already so in love! Everything is SPOT ON. The sushi burrito: I was nervous tbh. I can be a wimp sometimes. It was AMAZING! Garlic edamame was delicious. I will absolutely be back! And soon.   Oh and good prices too! Even specialty rolls are $10 - $12. Not bad at all.

7eUpnL6x111mUCz0rJ-64A.text: This is one of our go-to places if we crave Asian food in Scottsdale, AZ. The menu selection is really great, along with a nice Happy Hour menu!   We'll definitely be back!

ooCdSoCzUSOlZfZ0cwkuNQ.text: Sake bombs, sushi rolls, free edamame (check-in offer), and a small plate of salmon sashimi on happy hour! Thoroughly enjoyed my dinner and night out with friends here! The restaurant was vibrant and filled up quickly for dinner time. Unfortunately after too many sake bombs I forgot to take any pictures.  I see a lot of other reviews saying that this place is not authentic or that it's not good, but I enjoyed all the food I had here. I would not say it's the best sushi in the valley, but it is still a fun and tasty spot with pretty good happy hour deals. Famed sushi chef Charles P. Thompson once said "I'm not making art, I'm making sushi" and that quote completely embodies the vibe here at Zu Izakaya.

CuFiIwTNCWVhq4IMdVWNuA.text: The interior has a very nice Japanese feel. We came right on time for happy hour.  Skewers are above average, salmon Kama is cheap and Alfredo Udon is subpar.

JyfRoA9WGj-lj9y8FzUuow.text: Went here for date night and had the best time! Food was delicious and there were so many options. We got the crunch salmon roll, the jalapeno Vegas roll, the butter corn, fried oysters, and the seafood Alfredo udon. Going for happy hour is a must! The seafood Alfredo udon was a big portion and it was amazing.   We sat in the bar area and the service was on point! Elisa was our server and she was very attentive. We waited a little bit for our food to come out because we came during dinner time which gets pretty busy but nonetheless, our food came out fresh and everything tasted better than we expected for the price. Will definitely be back here try all the other items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Butter Corn
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Alfredo Udon Crunch salmon roll Jalapeno Vegas Roll 2 Pieces of Oyster Tempura Butter Corn

mRgb8-KFFtyxeW0GDyAiNQ.text: The food and atmosphere is great. Gives off an LA K-town vibe. Evan took care of us and was really attentive. I later found out he was new and so that was even more impressive! The happy hour menu is extremely solid, with great options. Definitely gonna come back here to try some of their other dishes.

t3CRx8P55Daa_17_d9exBw.text: I can't spell it. I can't pronounce it. I can't really tell you what I ate, but it was all pretty tasty.  The concept is like  an Asian Tapas Bar. Plenty of small plates of various dishes including tempura shrimp, salmon, california rolls, tofu, edamame,  and some other sushi dishes.   Main entr'ee I ordered was called Scallop Dynamite, one of many signature dishes. This was a baked scallop, salmon, chopped onion, carrot, mushroom, mozzrella cheese, teriyaki sauce, and spicy aioli dish served with a side of rice. It was all very good.  Busy place, good service, interesting Friday night crowd of people. Prices were very reasonable. Put this one on your list!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tofu Dish
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tempura Shrimp
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Edamame ( You just eat the beans)

Hj54zzZk7z_PL_-7yEmbOw.text: Rolls at happy hours should be your bestie. As I said before, always go in happy hours time. I was craving rolls at night time and this place offers a happy hour from 9pm-11pm.  I had three rolls: Spicy Yellowtail rolls without crab mix: which was very good. I thought it was salty but turns out I added a lot of soy sauce. You will feel everything on it. I like this one. Philly rolls: this rolls was made in an excellent way. Cream cheese made it more tasty. Believe me, you will like it.  Las Vegas rolls without eel sauce and crab mix: if there is more than five stars, I would give it to this dish! Excellent and delicious dish. The best Vegas roll I had so far. This dish will make you speechless. Was prepared very good and the taste was phenomenal.   Friendly staff. I would come again for the rolls and the prices of happy hours! I recommend everyone to try the rolls here!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Las Vegas Roll
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy hours menu

D86b8-i9CB3GSIn__N3pJQ.text: Came here at around 4:30pm yesterday and we were able to be seated quickly. Ordered 3 sushi rolls (shown in attached photo) as well as a takoyaki. Not gonna lie, the takoyaki looked almost like swedish meatballs so I was hesitant at first to try them but they certainly were not "yaki" whatsoever! (Oo my first pun in a yelp review) Didnt come out too hot so my tongue was spared this time around. As for the rolls, those were pretty yummy as well. I couldnt handle the jalapeno one well due to my weak spice tolerance (still ate it though). Favorite out of the 3 was the crunch salmon roll - mainly cause I love salmon. Overall, no complaints, made for a nice (and early) dinner with family and friends. I gave 4 and not 5 stars mainly because the taste quality was above average but not something I'd give 5 stars for.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

JHioU3otuzX6rHQwyg09yA.text: "This place is like a white college student tried to make asian food."  "Ramen noodles are you kidding me?"  "Only the white people think this is good asian food.  "Pandas chicken was better..."  Hear me out,  This is honestly a sad excuse of an "asian fusion" restaurant. I have no idea how bad asian food must be in arizona for this to be a 4.5 star right now.  what we ordered:  My family ordered the asian fried chicken, coconut curry ramen, tonkatsu, and the Kal bi.  The fried chicken looked (and tasted) like it was made at panda express. please don't get this. The coconut curry was literally made from instant noodles (of some form) definitely packaged. Tonkatsu was the one pretty good thing on this menu. 7/10 on my list of katsu places. The Kal bi was straight up fat. I don't know if thats the style or something but you know it's a problem when the veggies under the dish tasted better than the actual meat. also, got a chicken stick that was fine as usual.  staff was friendly. price was reasonable. portions were big. free edamame (overcooked beans).   Yelp community please fix this horribly mistaken yelp rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. free Edamame

FwFvWPTqdjuzMPNm-rk_PA.text: The partner-in-dine and I came here for a late-night dinner after walking along Tempe Town Lake. Service was prompt and attentive. All the food came out fast. We ordered chicken, meat ball and quail egg on skewers. They were given more of a Korean twist than what we were used to back in Japan. They were quite good.  We also got the California roll and tuna roll which were generous and satisfying. I couldn't resist but get the Jjambbong hot pot, which was described as Korean-style spicy hot pot with assorted seafood, vegetables, and pork with ramen noodles. It was heartwarmingly tasty with a spicy undertone.  The partner-in-dine also got Japanese sake which reminded us of good times.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mochi ice cream and Tamajiman sake.

Mg6vowhsbgVosaoA8VQKOA.text: Went there for my birthday with my son and his wife and my granddaughter.   I had the seafood hot pot, and they had the veggie tempura and the chicken teriyaki.  And since I'm a Yelper, we had the edamame gratis for checking in.  I thought my seafood hot pot was good as well as the tempura and the chicken teriyaki.   My son was non impressed.   He gave it a 5/10 rating.   He thought his teriyaki was so-so and the tempura greasy.   I thought the teriyaki was good and the tempura the usual greasy.  I would go back.   My son, I think not.

MBxZuvWQTc5nnYv79Uiosg.text: Came here last minute on a late night food hunt , was bummed they didn't have the full kitchen open just happy hour . Was craving sushi but Kevin the bartender sold us on how tasty the happy hour is . We got the chicken skewers which were very tasty and the disassembled corn was delish , I'm glad that we shared it though it's very rich and heavy . But imagine street corn in a hot skillet melted with glorious cheese . It seems to be quiet the neighborhood happy hour spot with amazing prices for food and drinks , I gave it four stars cause it wasn't the cleanest, But of course the service and personality's there were appreciated on a late close to closing night .

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Skewer,  Butter Corn Chili Garlic Edamame

JEjsB-Gzk9i_xCmjGFwS8w.text: Fish:  My favorite four-letter f-word; followed by "food!"  ;)  We all met up here this past Saturday as an early birthday celebration to Yelp's favorite orange-clad man: Jon H.! And if you know Jon, you know his favorite hour is Happy Hour [for the alcohol, duh!]. Good thing Zu Izakaya has an amazing and extensive Happy Hour menu. We ordered pretty much everything on the HH menu with a few bottles of Nihon Sakari Junmai sake on the side for a great price tag!  We had a little bit of everything but the stars were definitely the fried calamari and Wasabi Hamachi [not on the HH but definitely worth getting]. To also be enjoyed were gyoza, seaweed salad, squid salad, egg rolls, mozzarella sticks, agedashi tofu, and some various rolls and nigiris. Jon made sure we used our Yelp check-in offer for the free edamame as well. We were practically rolled out of there like a hamster on a hamster wheel but we were happy and full.   Service here was great. We had the lovely Leah as our server with her uncanny Snow White resemblance and James as well. That kid really had his work cut out for him since Jon seemed to enjoy picking on him. ;)   I would definitely come back for that HH menu and to try that Spam & cheese katsu with a bowl of seafood alfredo udon and a bottle of Sayamacha Umeshu Green Tea Soju on the side.

aQVqgU1nJCeBxvalBT46zg.text: Great customer service, Evan our server is amazing! Food was also delicious and happy hour at 4pm right when they open!? Even better! The food was delicious. Come here for happy hour!

w9Yufm_pln6scVYjZHhVAA.text: One of our new favorite sushi places. We loved everything we tried today ... big thanks to Kevin our server and his honest and excited suggestions. Try the sriracha shrimp ... this was the star of today's evening. Slightly unexpected and unusual roll topped with the shrimp but yummy never the less. We usually stick it our usual sashimi fair but Kevin seemed extremely positive about the rolls and esp. the ebi mayo and the sriracha shrimp rolls and we were glad for the detour.   The salmon was also amazing today, fresh and absolutely tasty.

I give it four stars only because service was just incredibly slow the day that we went. Like. We waited 30 minutes for our check to be taken away.

tNoW3FEyw9NoqTDU9rWjHQ.text: Everything we ordered here from the sea weed salad, miso soup, skewers, were very good.  The sushi - ordered a Chirachi bowl, was ok but probably not known for their sushi anyway.  I would definitely be back for more skewers, good drinks, and some more things we didn't try out but looked great like udon.

F-VMxbnxHg-VAMNknglUnQ.text: This is one of my frequent guilty pleasures - happy hour from 4-7 pm AND 9-11 pm? Sold. Couple that with delicious food, fantastic prices, excellent service and you're off to the races. We had the Yaki Udon, Sriracha Shrimp Roll, and two bottles of Sake. There's a bar conveniently located in the back to keep the party going. I'm two bottles of Sake deep, so I'll stop this review while I'm ahead. Bon appetit!

hDTGDpfJUFzgkr5sLolCPg.text: Stopped by here prior to flight back to my hometown. Hubs and I were craving sushi and yakitori and this place had both!  They have happy hour every. single. day! I was stoked.  Ordered probably every kind of yakitori off the menu, our favorite was hands down the mushroom. It was so juicy! I think they use the same glaze for all of them. The sushi was great as well, packed full of fish, big portions! The drinks were also affordable. Tried banana makkoli for the first time and it was bomb. I read from the other reviews they serve it in a kettle with drinking bowls but didn't get that ): Servers attentive and friendly. Would recommend!

5Z1y4AtS-lQQdwdFAEhG3g.text: Update: Dined in this time to celebrate my graduation. We made happy hour and there was a great selection of food and drinks. I really enjoyed the Las Vegas roll and the corn!! This place made me a sushi lover ;)

4UMOkfBrVEGKEZlLf6ff6Q.text: K K A N P U N G G I  . Korean style deep fried chicken with spicy sauce. . . Sauce wasn't too spicy for my preference. However, the chicken was mouthwatering served with a side of rice.  . I highly recommend this restaurant, we came on a weekday and it wasn't busy at all! They gave us the option to have a regular table or go to the bar. The bar always has happy hour.  . Yum yum yum  Next time I'll be ordering more grilled chicken skewers served with japanese yakitori sauce! . . I love trying new foods!!  .  #AZteacherfoodie

_4Li62rylRu7iiA6LTT1WA.text: Cleaned up pretty well! Hot pot was by far my favorite. The sushi was decent and the sake bomb all day deal was da bomb.com. Would definitely recommend this place and will come back. Yum yum!

gC0j7HwGPG7_24KCiZc-Ig.text: Excellent service and food came very quickly even when busy. Very impressed with the food quality and cleanliness of the restaurant. Recommend the garlic tuna roll! Also should try the khannaghi (fried chicken and sweet/sour sauce) but we might ask for sauce on the side next time.

9yULIXNrbmPSlYkABLuh-Q.text: Happy hour was excellent! Great specials on Sapporo beer. All of the sushi rolls were excellent! The gyoza was very tasty and prepared perfectly. This is one of the best sushi happy hours in the valley!

HpYSc4aWwCC9-CY5y0FKjg.text: This place has come a long way since I first came. Food was great! They had a cute little outside patio too. Definitely recommend!

FEEjUy5fzklutWW5eTlbjA.text: Great Happy hour. Food is definitely a good value and the service has been very attentive both times we've come in.  Good place for a drink or two after work or a reverse happy hour later in the evening.

JyCwk91yO4g2ciasdzqN0w.text: The enviroment here is so good. The food is delicious. It's really suit for friends' metting. I love it!

al45wgNWaIz6Fd8F-xZLuw.text: Large menu selection to cater to your taste buds. Happy hour everyday! Quick, fast, Kind and friendly service. We got the garlic spicy tuna roll and it tasted so fresh and amazing! We also got hotspot and it was perfect for the cold and rainy day. All in all we had a wonderful experience here.

aUKgiwVWcBlDS_THLL0Dvg.text: The coconut currey bowl was excellent, tasty but not too spicy.  Atmosphere was trendy and fun. Started with edamame, closed with mango mochi. We will be back!

Enjoyed the music selection as well.  Sake & soju bombs are a nice deal.  I look forward to trying more of the selections on the menu

DjvbcXlUrUjVNHvp6YlFtg.text: Great place! I went on a Saturday night to try this place. It was busy and we got as much attention from our server as expected on a Saturday night. She informed us our sushi will probably come out first because the kitchen was backed up and we had no problem with that... to our surprise, no joke maybe 5 or 10mins later our food started coming out. It was tasty and amazing service for a Saturday night. I will definitely return

YJN4ZX-m0DhaheumUoG7uQ.text: Highly recommend the gochujang salmon - raw salmon pieces in a spicy-sweet sauce with onions and avocado, served with rice ($14.95 for a fairly large portion.) We'd never had anything like it and were PLEASANTLY surprised. The lighting of the restaurant also creates a great vibe.

fRSFBjGoYbKfwwEPuoG1MQ.text: Best sushi burrito ever! The bulgogi was phenomenal and  the sashimi bowl was definitely worth the money. Overall, the value of the food was definitely there. Would recommend to any sushi lover!!!

-jhzZuJfWCPVKjYp1EC45A.text: Great atmosphere it has a very chill vibe. Open late which is great. The food is always on point. So far I have tried the Bulgogi Tacos, Agedashi Tofu, Gyoza, and the Spicy soft Tofu Pot. Drinks are always fairly priced. Service is fast

lDk6TvgcEcR2bbmn0xKsrw.text: So good, i didn't even have a chance to take a picture of my Las Vegas roll. It was my first time, i order take out. It was delicious.

Yl5WV2In9BzWIKfSy3Mwkg.text: Needed to find a good place to eat that was open late. Our party of 9 was seated about 10pm. We were presently surprised by the menu, the food and the service. Great mix of Japanese and Korean fare. I have traveled to Japan and Korea a lot, and so I have high expectations for this kind of food. They did not disappoint. The sushi, the hot pots, and galbi were all excellent.  We will be back!

V2C2zG67oerdM8AZ8m4_qA.text: On point!!  Life long Californian, now living in Camp Verde....my standard is high  Service was right on, never had to wait for servers to come by.  Sushi was great with a hint of sweet rice.  Ask for the fresh wasabi....DELICIOUS ($2 per)  The rolls during happy hour felt a bit pre-prepared, but still tasty!  JoJo, super adorable and friendly.  Husband and I loved it overall!

w--ituSSf7c49Qf3sG0oGg.text: This place was great. Lovely lady took our orders, food was delicious, and the price was reasonable. I would recommend this to anyone.

PHPBKL-1Nywue6YanJGyiQ.text: Quick service. Delicious food. Convenient location. What's more to love? Boyfriend said they were the best Vegas rolls he's ever had. The bulgogi was better than the Korean restaurant! Very good and will definitely be bringing some friends back.

GnWwBkMxgs5lke0sbwseeg.text: Is good restaurant. The special roll is delicious. The restaurant is quie. It is good place for dating.

SaW5xyXGBcx1xUK17pcMXg.text: Chili garlic edamame and sushi were both great. James is a very attentive waiter as well. Will definitely come back.

kf0SxPych0kFUYtkS0LhWw.text: Very friendly service, good happy hour prices and the food was delicious. I particularly loved the chicken skewers.

j_zqSET7LVEu_Z_qWhxcuw.text: My family and I (big group) came in here randomly after going to Zoolights and they were so quick to accommodate! They weren't even shocked that a giant group without prior warning just showed up. They just asked for a second to set up and we were giving our orders in almost no time at all. Sushi's good. Hot pot is good. Chicken, beef, veggies, all good. Service was attentive and made sure we were treated right. This place is out of the way for a regular visit but anytime we're in the area, we'd definitely have this place on top of the list of a place to eat.

r4WEonTWvpkhYO4Ht-2Z1Q.text: This is my first time coming here and the food is great! I recommend the squid salad, and sushi. The service here is great, and so are the prices. I definitely will be coming back here again!

-OtM8xPppwMbbrHKkYhrQg.text: Great atmosphere and sushi is on point! Butter corn is awesome too. Love the service here. If you are looking for great Korean/Japanese food this is definitely the spot! :)

EQpMwb_j0ozGQ8aT-0Hk6g.text: We came here for happy hour, they have very few options for happy hour. Sushi and the rolls taste good, service is good. Good place to hangout with friends. They have range of alcoholic drinks, we didn't try them though. The crab cakes are made of imitation meat so vegetarians can try them, but they are fried unlike the real ones.

mfcpX20if7PA8phGB_8ltA.text: Every time I come here the vibes are awesome, they have good music and the food is fucking delicious.

qbwKwiRvfGwMFJKzpQhM4A.text: Short walk from my house and I love how they have happy hour every day from 4-7. If I could recommend one thing it would be the chili garlic edamame. I have to go whenever I start craving it. I have yet to go to karaoke at night but I've heard it's supposed to be fun

6LYC1BG3IloxYH3Lss4jPA.text: Amazing food! Great prices ! extra large servings and unique large different menu with a creative twist to all dishes different than all sushi places around here !!!

8FKd_tt4M1pyoaUzPWXGwA.text: Great sushi and kimchi spot. We ordered the spicy kimchi hot pot, pico de Gallo and garlic spicy tuna roll. Delicious. Get the soju flavored w blueberries for something different. Enjoy!

iOKXXCG00EA3UfSri9rTkQ.text: As a Bay Area native, it is so hard to find GOOD sushi in AZ, but this place is as good as it gets to Bay Area sushi and Asian food. Came here with a large group for a bday dinner during their late night happy hour. We had several people waiting on our group who were all patient with group in ordering and making 7 different tabs. It was very much appreciated.  As far as the food, we had ordered an array of different items: Las Vegas roll, philly roll, shrimp roll, bulgogi plate, hot pot, roasted peppers, chicken skewers. Everyone loved their dishes. The sushi was so fresh and had great flavor. I did not try the hot pot but those who got it kept raving about it. One friend who has been to Japan several times had said hot pot was pretty authentic.   Definitely recommend trying this place out!

io68pmrWBwzfe_vqEwoujQ.text: Pretty good sushi spot. Nice happy hour and specials for Yelp and Instagram review. Must try is their jalapeno Vegas roll

rAK0lLE2vlzrgzVjviI2kw.text: The food is really good. I had the Las Vegas roll and chicken wings and both were very delicious. They also have a really good happy hour too. Every day from 4 to 7 . Will definitely be back!

xzGiKj5fDOIYOldZn1oing.text: Service is slow and terrible I think.  The reviews are stellar but that wasn't what we saw.  The skewer items were good and expect smaller portion, the sashimi was good not great, and getting a drink was tough.  20-30 minutes.  Glad we tried it but won't go back.

D0iF-tBOb0Nlktu9Y_TamA.text: Min was awesome on her first week of work. The sushi was also fresh and the ambiance was nice.

tTURNvnqIpmCXUGmCtTcMg.text: Our food was mixed. Salmon kama and scallop hand roll were good. Tuna and mackerel nigiri were not good at all, mainly due to the rice. No flavor, dry, not formed well, cold. But no question, our biggest complaint is the overwhelming smell of bathroom cleaner that permeated the entire restaurant. We thought it was maybe a fluke because we came in near the bathrooms at the front door, but it was evident in the dining room as well. No one should use that amount of fabulosa. Gross.

xxKEY1_yiGHFFtR0eBI-4Q.text: Great spot with great food but the best part is the bar in the back. It's a tucked away little gem with a great little atmosphere! And they have a great karaoke catalogue.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great food, but the best part is that they have an awesome little bar with Karaoke. Oh yeah and they have the best oranges.

Ogwr2W69WdB6tYmi5fkwyw.text: I knew this place would be good when I found out it was owned by the same people that own Sushi Ave in Gilbert. We came in on a Thursday during happy hour and were surprised it didn't seem very busy. Our waitress seemed very attentive and provided good recommendations. We had some fried Shishito peppers, Alaska roll, and Hana peach sake to start. The peppers were sweet and spicy and tasted very fresh. We followed up with some salmon and albacore sashimi--I definitely recommend the salmon, some of the best I've had in the area, quite tender and fatty. Green tea mochi was also tasty. We'll definitely be back to try more.

6NcVHkt-5eQvqrJUodcjAw.text: Sake is incredible. Udon noodles with chicken was delightful with sweet soy.  Must have Saki to enjoy. Love the music.

Te221CZKIhAWhZOMnIpCyA.text: So went here on the star rating and was not impressed. Being from San Francisco I have high expectations in sushi. But knowing where I am I wasn't expecting greatness. Well they did not even meet them. The fish was not fresh and was almost hard to eat, the garlic edamame was pretty good. But that's all I could say about this place. The couple I was with and myself felt a little under the weather later that night after dinner. Not saying it was the food but I could of been. Will not be back.

_t1zCPDBpWdTJ4m97QwPNw.text: Went here last month for my birthday, soooooo yummy! The set up of the restaurant with the bar and the actual restaurant was a little confusing but it wasn't that big of a deal. And we only spent about $80 for 4 people and we got A LOT of food

FGYOHmWyQwz-c7lFprLKFg.text: Came here for dinner a couple of weeks ago and was surprised by how good the food was. We ordered the kkanpungi (Korean fried chicken with sauce) and the grilled chicken, which was served on a sizzling hot skillet. Both dishes were served with a bowl of white rice. Both chicken dishes tasted phenomenal. The rice was sticky and cooked to perfection.  They have a lot of seafood options, which made me sad, as I don't have a taste for things from the ocean. But if you're into that kind of thing, I bet it's great! Besides seafood they do have a lot of other options. For next time I've got my gaze set on the coconut curry hot pot...  I would not hesitate to come back. The food is on the pricey side, but if you can afford it, it's totally worth it!

VEKchyBJ7eilJA4m6dRuvw.text: Great ambience and amazing customer service! Their menu has a large selection and the food is delicious. Recommend the hotpot for something fresh, warm, and hits the spot on a rainy day or an AC'd restaurant

xW4l5hlhbbFfFDzKg9F7xQ.text: Great location and food! Waitresses are nice.    You get some free dishes if you review online.

J2mOdhAhkVUmlRxJn8R9ig.text: Great little restaurant. We had a couple appetizers and main dishes and everything was excellent. The wait staff was very courteous and knew when to approach the table and when not to. Will definitely eat here again when in town

PTX-dLAB6vph1zcllnI_kA.text: We ordered 3 signature rolls and a Gyoza appetizer and everything was amazing. We loved everything and the service was great. Nice atmosphere and clean place. I recommend eating here.

E5k8zGUz7zG-Y6f_OxTCAA.text: We were on vacation in Phoenix, were hungry and it was about 10:30pm. We looked on Yelp for anything with late night dining around the Tempe area and we found this place. Thank you Yelp! This was such a good suggestion for a late night dinner and we really liked the food. They have Japanese food and also varieties of Korean food. We were also lucky enough to make it just in time for happy hour and took advantage of the cheap appetizers. I really liked the sushi burrito, shisito peppers, and the kkanpungi (korean style deep fried chicken with sweet spicy marinade). Definitely try this out if you're in the area.

408WKd0Wi-ncw36jFWHTug.text: The unagi tamago bowl was really good! The water was really good too, you know how some places kinda just half ass it and give you tap water. This place is not the case!

1Gmd588tySkAR_UCG4x39A.text: Good food! Great service!! The server recommended a substitute for a rainbow roll and it was perfect!

y4wQJsPnZLI8iIXCkMAcUA.text: Amazing food and service! Perfect late night night spot for Asian tapas and drinks! Jojo provided phenomenal service! Can't wait to come back! When I think of good times, hot babes and great food - my mind goes immediately to zu izykaya.  AND THE SERVE MOTHER FREAKING PEPSI!  that's freedom.  #trumpsucks

KI2c13gj8NWOcTVgbVbwwQ.text: This place was amazing and didn't expect it. We had lots of great shrimp and sushi.  My favorite was the lollipops and tuna sashimi with Wasabi sauce! Also the staff was great...thanks Jo Jo your awesome!

TIzv_HOYoKeUWe8ryXRi1g.text: Delicious fresh food and great service! Been here a few times and it never disappoints... our favorite sushi restaurant in Scottsdale by far.

i6ZXFnPL95XqSOzmSBaVzQ.text: First time here and everything is so great!! We have ordered seafood hot pot and the ramen is really good. Gyoza is my fav!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

Kf73hU6Ih8zXw952YyZRdw.text: Good service in this restaurant. I enjoyed the seafood hot pot. The broth is pretty flavorful and I enjoyed the lofty amount of seafood that they provide to you. We were able to request steamed gyozas as well which were also pretty delicious. Overall not a bad place.

OsQI_bErYQDfLEtjxqr28A.text: Excellent food, even better service, and pretty good prices! We will definitely be going back again & again... Great for family dinner, after work event, or just eating!

T7M2uwQ9M1AIBWlcs1x-mw.text: the back bar has happy hour always, and that means a round of sake unfiltered and sushI is like 16 before tip. And they deserve the tip! Idk how they do it but I love sake sea weed salad and sushi and good alcohol so props to them for doing it  and doing it cheap.  Favorite

qC24A279nhqM5MbFUcS5AQ.text: Stop by Phoenix for dinner on the way back to Tucson, my wife glad that we make a right choice. Food delicious and good service.

pUZjdt7X3nvlnE9vzjTknA.text: What a rip off. I was offered a coupon for a free sake with a hot pot. But when I went to leave they charged me and said I had to pay. Apparently the wording on the offer was incorrect. I guess this food establishment does not understand the concept of the customer is always right, instead they defended their position and insisted I pay. I would have gone back as the food was good, but I will not go back now and I would recommend you don't try it as there are other better run and managers sushi places.

YLVX2w4p-3bWr7oRmp9Fcw.text: Very nice restaurant-bar with the perfect atmosphere to drink up izakaya-style with your buddies. Highly recommend the skewers, squid salad and rolls. Soak it up with their multiple selections of Korean hot pots and wash it down with Orion beer (from Okinawa).

h1OZcoA0sk-q9p791flWJA.text: I'm an Out of town business traveler  and decided to try a different Sushi place from my norms. Just ordered a pair of Rainbow Rolls but was pleasantly surprised. Food was great and service was top notch.

on8ggZpfYGvXgeg7qagloA.text: Came late on a Saturday and split a bunch of appetizers and other small bites. The  buttered corn and chili garlic edamame were both delicious! The egg rolls were mediocre. We tried both asparagus and garlic skewers -- highly recommended the asparagus! The garlic was oddly flavorless. We topped it off with veggie tempura and plain old rice, and both were very tasty. (Yes, the plain rice was noteworthy.)   Can't speak to the entrees, but definitely recommend for this tapas-like experience.

12UAvzisejRFAauBTQKULg.text: Fantastic spot with great happy hour options and amazing food. Open late too! Be sure to try their hot pots (great deal and large portions). A huge selection to choose from so we will be back for a third time soon.

uBpQf3sI5LfzKzQjUn07vQ.text: Great atmosphere and location! The staff is nice and the happy host is great. It's walking distance to my house so the $7 sake bombs are where it's at! Come check em out! The egg rolls are awesome, and the sushi is good too! Come check em out!

311zrvGDmsqRQotdF1DEsQ.text: This is our second time eating here. Food is delicious! Service excellent! Great music! We had the bulgogi, and a hot pot with  pork, spam , kimchi, and lots of mushrooms! Wonderful!

qvQC3V4GgdcgVSvUr58FCQ.text: My belly is so HAPPY right now! Food is delicious! Speedy service! Everyone is extremely friendly. Second time coming here and will come again and again!

QjQw94VkXSpQUT8y0sMmTw.text: Great selection of sake and a decent happy hour. One of the best philly rolls I've had in Scottsdale.

nXWRym2T2D0XKwYvfXV6dg.text: Went there last night with friends, reserved a table, and they were not kidding when they said you should bring friends to sample lots of food! We all wanted in each other's plates. The service was pleasant and patient when we ordered multiple times instead of all in one go. Was really a great environment. What led me here was all the pictures on yelp but sad to say I was having too much fun I forgot to snap a lot of pics to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Finally found me some soju!

My3xasLK0Ho2HBpccVQFWQ.text: Great atmosphere and staff. Happy hour is awesome! Very satisfied. :)

xjFsSIyjgqe5CEgtBNsamQ.text: I've driven by this restaurant many times and we decided to stop for dinner. So glad we did!  Food is fantastic... all of it and we ordered many things.  The Tang Soo Yuk was perfect along with unagi bowl, eel and Vagas sushi rolls. Even their edamame is well prepared. Oh and the fried tofu in broth was good.  Then on top of that, our server was so friendly and on top of getting is what we needed.  Will be back again for more :)

2lVucWvFsUbR59G64BsTEQ.text: This is a authentic Asian late night joint. Always something on the menu to satisfy you. The Mochi is definitely one of the most amazing desserts I have tried. Highhhhhhly recommended!

U1V-6_aWlYDZCQW6bRjOeQ.text: Try the spicy tuna roll, it's incredible. The lighting is great for insta pics (highly recommend happy hour lighting till about 7). The ambience is nice and relaxing with a good music mix.  Also one of the few places where you can find mochi ice cream which is love itself in small, mouthwatering morsels.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green tea Mochi ice cream

85WLICGWtRQpd1vNu0ZFdA.text: Cool chill place to grab some fresh sushi. Like the ambiance, good service and good Happy hour.

RCBkeZ5MjCy3XXXINsfp3w.text: Updated five stars for happy hour on Friday! Food has been on point every time we came here. Definitely a go to spot when out of ideas where to go.

WCnoXkgtASDxhW-FOLaF2A.text: Loved our waiter very personable. Got in right away. First time trying a sushi burrito. It was pretty good sushi.

j34-sDAoztDId7k_TUhc4g.text: We had jjambong pot. Chicken skewer. Bulgogi dynamite roll, and rolled egg. Everything was very delicious and our server was so kind. Service. Food. And atmosphere was good enough. I will come back to try different food here.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

3wL30r_qKEmTWo7IjYLBhQ.text: As always service is just good enough that you can't complain but you arent wowed 3.5 stars for service.  Tuna sushi 2 stars it was not good and pieces too big.  The Mackerel, WOW! Best sushi I've ever had, 5 stars. The Yellowtail, I've had yellowtail many times I give them 4 stars, again the pieces are too big. Great experience definitely going back for sushi!

WAwTm1qIV5Wv8EuGBdBSeg.text: This is a fun little sushi spot right off of Scottsdale Rd.! I've driven past it so many times and finally decided to stop in. The atmosphere is great with awesome music playing and an attentive staff. The shishito pepper appetizer was so yummy! I would suggest that as a must try. The egg rolls were also delicious. However, the appetizer portion only comes with three rolls, so make sure to order more than one if you have a big group! The sushi was just as good as their other location, Bei, right down the street. The Lollipop Roll was fun and actually stayed together when I picked it up on the stick! It's very refreshing having a roll wrapped in cucumber rather than rice. I also suggest the Ebi Mayo Roll. The shrimp that tops this roll are fantastic! I don't know how they make them but you have to try it out! YUM!

d04viTqQq80PlSv1nUxJFQ.text: Great sushi and hot pots! The sushi is so fresh and the hot pot easily feeds two people white left overs. Happy hour is on certain drinks, sushi and appetizers from 9pm until 11pm daily   We had the garlic spicy tuna roll which was amazing!!! It was spicy so if you don't like hot food, then don't get this buy it was such a unique taste. We also had the salmon sashimi - talk about fresh and tasty! Hands down, best sushi I've had.  We had the Jjambbong hot pot which was also tasty but spicy.  It was a seafood and pork soup/broth that had ramen in it with rice on the side. This was a pretty big meal though so it's definitely for sharing.   All in all, next time in I'm Scottsdale, I will definitely be back and try the other dishes.

0pTNgbyiYQ4XkXy2kmUPxQ.text: Really good sushi, really good service. My mom and I went twice when I was out to visit over Memorial Day weekend, once during a late happy hour, and then once more for early dinner. The rolls were great both times (we stuck to California, Philly, and shrimp tempura), and the second time we also had the yellowtail nigiri, which was fantastic.  Overall, a very solid choice for fresh, well-made sushi, and we'll definitely go back.

UOMd_n9jlbEHZggQe2Ifcg.text: This place is really good. They have two separate dining areas. One is a bar area and the other is the casual dining. Their food is really good but I have had better asian food in general. I would still recommend it for the variety of food selection they carry if you are not looking for something specific and just going with the flow.

zeSgKFbwn8GgQJb95H-h_g.text: Great service & great food. We ordered the Bulgogi Mushroom bowl and it was delicious. Food came out on a timely manner and our waitress was friendly. Definitely will come back for everyday happy hour!

J04OXkhN1PEKoo161EvMPQ.text: Visited this restaurant twice now and both times the food was great. The young man who seated and served us was very attentive and very personable. We had rolls, agedashi tofu, skewers, and fish collar and all were very good. It's a little dark inside but friendly staff and great food!

LKlsjrW2kEPpaLvACLiFMQ.text: We order couple of rolls, salad, and a couple of skewers. Sushi rice was hard. Seaweed salad was really good.  We were given wrong skewers and the waitress made it seem like it was our fault that she put the wrong order in... Overall the place is pretty cool, service wasn't good and the food was mehh

prS0BReY4ZRjekKHpo5nlg.text: Ordering process was a bit tedious.  Lots of up-charges for any variations of the menu items.  Food was acceptable.  Nothing special.  If I never go back, that will be fine.  Edamame was good.  Skimpy seaweed portion in the Poke. Plus be prepared for cold rice in the Apple. I liked my water.

YUDYqfx5BP0AS5fHtJndSA.text: Looks really good in here. Place is clean and nicely done. We're from Las Vegas and spoiled with great restaurants. This is up to par with out great restaurants. Looking forward to great early dinner and here for Happy Hour.   After eating  Food was great and will for sure come back when in town again.

R5-73sOG1vfF2GOhD5gjLA.text: Cool little spot with neat decor. Ordered chicken skewers, edamame, jalapeno and the regular Las Vegas roll, and the spicy seafood miso hot pot. Loved the chicken skewers, super tasty. Las Vegas roll was oddly sweet which I was just not a fan of. The hot pot was highly regarded and sounded really good but unfortunately it was super salty, even for me and I like salty things, to the point where I could only eat just a little and it was not spicy one bit which was really disappointing. Not sure I'd be willing to come back to try other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cool little lamps outside the bathrooms
Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#34;Spicy&#34; seafood hot pot

uQIIqtpJUqPwNVnxVuWrxw.text: The Vegas roll was incredible and the service was great! Salmon Sashimi is fresh and melts in your mouth.

6AEOLjEFendVJbPuVaSB4w.text: The shishito peppers were seriously amazing, went during happy hour and got so many appetizers for so cheap. A great place to try some new food and hang at the bar or in the dining room

rHZ4ZiOoODuWuaDcjAyZMg.text: Very close to home! Great vibes! Love the eagerness of the servers! Chili garlic edamame is delicious! Must have! Definitely Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious chili garlic edamame !!

J-BaFnAGEH3zimXekoXVjg.text: Food is so delicious! Service was great!! Had such a great dinner!!! We got the Vegas Roll, the Salmon and Yellowtail shishimi, and the amazing garlic edamame! Best edamame I've ever had! We also got the Albacore Roll and Banzai Roll...all we're so delicious!!

tw1kmHL66W1HxbTTKfkTXA.text: This is one of my favorites restaurants in Arizona! My best friends and I come here whenever possible and it's great that it's opened til 2AM during the weekends. I absolutely love the appetizers like the cheese spam Katsu and neobani sliders. The cheese spam is definitely a guilty pleasure since it's so heavy but it's perfectly crisp and cheesy. I'm also obsessed with their skewers, which are usually on their happy hour menu (did I mention they have HH and reverse HH?). The Scallop Dynamite is my all time favorite! It has scallop, salmon, cheese, and mushroom so it's basically everything I love in one. Their sushi rolls and burritos are great too. Honestly, I have yet to order something I didn't like from here.  I can't wait to come back.   P.S The white peach sake is only $9 during happy hour and it is sooooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken skewer and Hana Fuji apple sake

vnSs-QL6xVPgPnLMxF1F_g.text: The service is very good, we had sufficient water in our glasses the whole dining experience. The food came out promptly and tasted freshly prepared. I recommend the spider roll as it was my favorite course of the meal. I will surely be coming back soon to try out the rest of their menu.

HZbRDTy0Vg5l78-tI5T3Ow.text: When the gf and I came in, we found that the place had great music and a very nice comforting environment. I decided to order 4 rolls and a Sapporo. Total was under $30 for 2. Price was perfect for eally great food. Fresh quality and served hot. Definitely going to come back.

F9NzNjCwIM1D8Z8J_2uV6Q.text: Deliscious sushi, with great prices for happy hour. Thoroughly impressed. Quick to be seated and great service. Will be back for happy hour.

K5ST2wKGWdjWGiip_OcpHQ.text: Good vibe, came a bit late so it was pretty quiet. Definitely a nice place to come with a group of people.  Would recommend it for a late nice hang out.

0oo50odCXvto9xED4o5FMA.text: We needed a good place to eat after picking some friends from the airport. Our criteria was Open late and drinks. This place fit the bill. Our waiter Jay was awesome. We got seated quickly, they had good selection of drinks and awesome appetizers. We tried the bulgogi tacos and wings. They had all kinds of meat skewers which were awesome with beer. Plus they had a separate karaoke bar in the back after your done eating to go and hang out. Karaoke was free and lots of fun. Good place to come if your are near the airport!

N0lGvJep3PbGS8cVyd8gFw.text: Very good service and atmosphere. I had sushi and it was delicious and fresh. I tried my buddies hot pot which was also delicious.

mHweUnmzx7-Lb1ukWYz6xw.text: Delicious!!! We ordered the Chicken wings (8 pieces) and the hot pot. They were very good and I'll recommend both of them. I will definitely come again!

gGU7ARSVMshPJemVHmEa6A.text: Extremely good food and nice service. Environment very nice. Recommend fresh eel grill and the very tasty quail egg skewers!!!!

IhWcuHEgY5um3Jrcy7_K5w.text: Our waitress gave great service and our sushi came out wonderfully. One of my favorite dishes was the poke bowl with salmon. I would recommend this place to my friends if they visit here

Xrzpo1fdJBE9wpmtL82aJg.text: I really like the skewers: shrimp and sausage are especially good. The waitress is very nice and the location is also a plus.

qM5hFj10lNbZckelAsoZ_Q.text: Great service great food! I had the bulgogi which was surprisingly small but it was definitely good. I also had the sushiritto of which was a surprisingly excellent snack.

8juVLDNMs9ST0q5pHNMeDw.text: We tried Zu Izakaya while visiting from the San Francisco Bay area. We didn't read any reviews and barely read the menu before choosing it, and I was so pleased! The maguro nigiri was tasty and well made. The tofu kimchi specialty was super tasty; note the dish's description if you don't eat meat: it has pork (mmmm pork!). And I got to try banana nigori sake; I'm usually a sucker for banana-flavored food and drink, and this was a treat! Service was very capable and attentive, though it was mostly empty on a Tuesday night so I can't really say how it might be when busy. 4 stars plus a strong desire to eat there again and give it 5.

YY-yv8jYbEkOeqhIW5fZww.text: Service was great super fast. Servers were considerate for my gf diet of gluten free. Large menu slightly confusing but happy hour till 7.

nJTL8wAhhrdskMFsc64rwA.text: Eel grill is delicious, I plan to eat ramen soup but no ramen soup here. So I order yaki udon .

6MCS50kS3som50M6J3XKEA.text: I had the bulgogi...meat was tasty but the veg was bland. Kimchi was mild but still had good flavor

qsQDvmd9ev1EQ2hj3rM2Ow.text: Happy hour specials are great. They also have reverse happy hour starting at 9 for that late night grubbing. Try the sushi burrito.

tq7FUJoVzV8JOO0IFyRzpw.text: This is a great place for friends meeting, the food choices is a lot, and all of them are delicious, We are super Asian food lover, recommend here!

OKeXdFLP4ieeCKEYNpwI_Q.text: I went whit my Daughter Firs Time the food we order was Delicious The service and the place very nice, We will be back soon.

vy2M9dfD5KmKtUITRLqskg.text: Love this place, delicious and good prices too! Great service!!! The sushi is unique and the most delicious I've had in the city! The service is very prompt and a great atmosphere! Perfect for a date night or a hang out with a group of friends.

ncLqRZc7PdrHZZ_UBlOgdQ.text: Great place. Great selection on sushi rolls as well as hot pot options. Very casual and welcoming atmosphere.

vFueCY5qX1n9YqRSVTd-Vg.text: This place has some of the most amazing flavorful food I've ever had without breaking the bank. We came here for reverse happy hour and you just can't beat $3 sapparo beers along with $7 sake bombers. The portions are huge I would suggest to share the bowls for sure. Service was excellent. We definitely can't wait to go back because there was a lot to choose from!

iFO9iW-u9EI2nUux1fQMnA.text: We arrived right after a rainstorm and were feeling chilly ( in Az. This is odd I know!)so we ordered the hot pot. It was so plentiful and delicious, we'll be back. Good thing they're open past 9 p.m. Since everything in the area seems to close so early.

6h-TvnnHAXjjOzU8hUbLCg.text: This is a nice relaxed place with good sushi, although i am more a fan of their skewers. The mochi ice cream is also delicious.  The service is friendly and attentive and the price is nice on the wallet.

59CODpet_XpIn0DAgLKM0A.text: This was a 4 star a couple nights ago. I went in and ordered the Pork Lettuce wraps. They were great. The service was a little slow but nothing horrible.  I returned tonight planning on trying the Chicken lettuce wraps. I should have stuck to my plan. I ended up ordering the Scallops Dynamite (based on the servers recommendation) It was basically a plate of cheese over vegetables with the smallest scallops is have ever seen. It must be some pretty high grade cheese for the price. It did not taste bad but entirely too much cheese and they could up the quality of the seafood in it.   In the end I will probably go back eventually and try something else as it is a clean place and the staff has been decent but I will never order that again.

c4es8AEehnBWNx5CIAIxuQ.text: Pleasently surprised. We decided to try this place for a date night and the food and service was wonderful. We had steamed gyoza, shrimp tempura, squid salad, rice and some sushi. It was all amazing. Highly recommend trying!

B_obWsVeh3ZghhhkGN8uag.text: Wasabi Hamachi Sashimi was excellent! Shrimp Tempura Roll was very good. Zucchini skewer was tasty. Service was great, and our server gave lots of recommendations. Price was fair. We are definitely going back for more.

-wglAmjdUkRwtK5x1-VJ5g.text: Love this place! The ambience is great, cozy and low key, great for dinner or getting drinks with friends.   Yummy food, reasonably priced, great happy hour menu, and James is great!

CYs6Xw1A2mFTvfrnHc48uw.text: Very authentic Asian spot! Very cool interior.  Clean!  Yummy delicious treats  I got the garlic spicy tuna roll. Jon got a pineapple soju. And we had a bunch of happy hour appetizers from 9-11pm.

WyBwHQNszcsi_FLWOlgqXA.text: Went here for a really late night dinner and there were only a few tables seated.  The service was...........wonderful....smile.  And so was the food.  Very fresh fish.  We had Chirashi Bowl, Quail Egg Sushi, Koshu Masamune House, Wasabi Hamachi, Yellowtail roll, Sake and tea.  Everything was great.  My only comment was the really dark atmosphere.  I guess it's hip?

uJcsu9DKvavWTsiD5PfHDg.text: Magnificent outlook building  Food quality awesome especially their Sashimi And I unagi bowl and Zu Poke bowl also great

da90HIWc2d7H8LHy2alihA.text: Food is great Elisa was our server and bartender. We came here for happy hour and it was great. You walk in and tell them your there for happy hour and they walk you to the back that's totally separate from the restaurant. Different at atmosphere for sure but I love it. Hot pots are a must and sushi lollipop.

GGe3KnpYFQzX4H1pMtDi_g.text: This place is a hidden gem.    I will be honest.  I remember when this was an Italian Buffet style place (never tried it) so I was always put off by the building I guess.   I had a friend suggest a girls dinner here and so glad she did!! Here is a run down of what we had and like:  We started with the Ahi Tacos and Chicken tacos - They come in two so this was perfect for the 4 of us each getting one small taco. Both were delicious- I did prefer the tuna over the chicken.   We also shared 2 orders of the Gyoza - perfectly crispy and a great dipping sauce - cant go wrong here  Happy Hour here is great!!   Now on to the GLORY of meals!  HOT POT HEAVEN!!  These bowls are HUGE and we each got our own (too much food).  I would share between two people or be ready for left overs.  I ordered the Spicy Kimchi Pot with no pork but tofu and mushrooms! So good - perfect spice level and great compliment with the kimchi.  My friend ordered the Jjambbong Pot - if you like seafood this is a must!!! It is packed with different seafood and the flavor is out of this world good ( waitress recommended this pot as well).  We ended up mixing both of our broths and made Hot Pot Magic. You're Welcome.  If you have seen this place while driving down Scottsdale next time stop in and try it out!! So worth it!

OxvQdgbAnruswPquJP9xvQ.text: Best sushi in Tempe area. The Tagarashi Tuna Roll is literally the most unique sushi roll I have ever had. Totally recommend. They also have real fresh wasabi.  I hate all of the chain restaurants. This one is the best non chain sushi restaurant I found around downtown Tempe.

Bs8MfmPmR4BhJULTNc2nXQ.text: Awesome happy hour specials and some of the best tempura I've ever had! We only had sushi but I saw the ramen and it looked fantastic.

olttUYsFIrqdL845wg4xOw.text: Zu was a wonderful surprise and the happy hour options were great. The Vegas roll and spicy tuna roll were wonderful and the presentation was very artful. Happy hour is every day from 4p-7p and 9p-11p.  Our waitress(es?) were extra attentive and provided us with everything we needed to enjoy our evening.  We'll definitely come again for the hot pots and chili garlic edamame.

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

OSGim7wMlJqFk6tmET3bJQ.text: First time in and overall atmosphere were good. The decor is somewhat typical sushi bar. Good location and easy parking. Ordered couple of skewers, a hot pot, rolls and side dishes, and honestly the foods were not that good except skewers. I've grown up with korean/japanes foods but the quality in the place is kind of disappointing. Staffs were very friendly but not well trained, especially for details in menu.  I could bump them up to 3 stars but young staffs made a noise at the corner of the restaurant all the time, which was so annoying

XjOcEv7Yo9_Ezkas0baYMQ.text: Great music and a welcoming ambiance make this a perfect date night restaurant. Fantastic service, sushi, and sake!

MlswpnsLVlkOD29gxEwpkg.text: Alisa was our server, she was amazing! Sat in the bar area, good call. Love the TVs and casual atmosphere. Sake was delicious, sushi was fresh! They have very fast service. Overall I was totally impressed. I will totally be back

WzGG6STg553jJRBrxQx3AQ.text: First time here. Excellent food and service especially on a Sunday night. Great atmosphere with excellent music. The Soju Bomb was the bomb! Excellent grilled salmon. Will be back!

kifv_2AQHndXOsXjBnOcFA.text: We live right down the street and love coming here! The egg rolls are AMAZING! We ordered a second one because they were so good. I've even sent my husband down to grab a side of rice for a dinner I cooked at home. I can't wait to see how the happy hour is!

bMkPV5Po0VxAezvsuieO3g.text: Absolutely fresh and delicious!!! Great happy hour with even better food. Friendly service and fun atmosphere. The Las Vegas roll is an absolute must and Kern is super cool.

MuxdLwd3mAmde5qcawD-Hg.text: Fantastic place. The staff is amazing. Best sushi I've had in Arizona... I am so lucky they are close to my house.

qFCuO6VYWb70JXsNqXqorA.text: Did a great job of seating our group of 8 without a long wait. Salmon Poke Bowl was excellent! Lots of salmon and full of flavor. Will definitely come back on our next trip to AZ.

UuTip8Yp6uY2BoOEjANhCw.text: I'm going to keep this simple. I don't think I can stop self from wanting to come here at least 3 times a week!! I am in love

TjlRXTmRmTXfdX_y39Tuxw.text: Tried some appetizers, salads, and a few grill items - everything was great.  Looking forward to going back and trying one of the hot pots!

We ordered two rolls from the happy hour menu, the coconut chicken curry hot pot, and one signature dish. My goodness!! The best Japanese/Korean food I have had in a long time! I'm not even a big curry kind of person but this was to die for! The best part is they are down the street from me! I will definitely be back!

5bJmd84jyUjKzj-iPOunjQ.text: My first time here & wow this place was f****g amazing! My server was Joline & I highly recommend her . She suggested the chicken, shrimp & shishito peppers skewers, tuna sashimi & marinated galbi. Damn son! 10/10 on the food! & they have Echigo beer !

MZZS5TWZlP_7ar2-66hWWg.text: Awesome service and great place for Happy Hour. The bulgogi hot pot was so good. It was very flavorful. I wish they had more glass noodle, however, rice is complementary. Rice was a good combination with the soup.

4rp1hnbcWiJiUtbahAkIQg.text: Awesome new place, great Happy hour and amazing service! Yummy gyoza and sushi rolls. We had pretty much everything on the happy hour menu and were happy with it. Our waiter was nice enough to come around a minute before happy hour ended to get us another round. Support your local spot! :)

EhcHTVc2AYT7xdyDn9gP0Q.text: Great atmosphere and great food! Service was friendly and quick and the food was fresh and flavorful. My personal favorite was the Las Vegas roll but I'll definitely be back to try more rolls.

N063Ni2ZdurcXoQCTFmlow.text: Awesome sushi spot! Best sushi my husband and I have had since we moved from Ventura, Califirnia. Ask for James

pMWv8LjBIEeMVcltrT_0Mw.text: I only gave it a four because of the music. The food was great and it was a diverse happy hour. It came out very fast and was all very good! I would come back here again.  I would recommend this place to others that visit in town.

HRq41q0t65oXAw9VOMHSKQ.text: Found this place late night on a Tuesday with my boyfriends keen eye after our first choice failed. Never being here before our server recommended the Yaki Udon, omg soooooo good! Definitely recommend this place any time. Good food and good service!!

ql4pcjUfWDHcldU31nfUVw.text: Yaki Udon WOW! could eat this every day.  Must try if you're in Scottsdale. Kimchi hot pot is also legit.

MOfaSNY4goPE-8jXC3focg.text: First time here since they opened. Went to the back bar which is pretty cool because it's separated from the restaurant and I can be obnoxious without disturbing diners. Ordered 6 items and all of the food was awesome. It was Daniels first day behind the bar and he was super nice. Will be back.

3Y6R-8bM5o3ejaqHN2lxOA.text: Extremely impressive!! They deserve more attention. It was not that busy when I was there. But the food was fantastic, from the quail egg skewer to the Bulgogi hot pot, savory, fresh and super delicious. Moreover they were all the choices from my server Sami picked out for us. That was a great first experience I had at Zu Izakaya. You should try!

ee541a_HbnuLA0vY_Ol8vA.text: Zu Izakaya is a cute little Japanese restaurant/bar that I've been to quite a few times. They have a beautiful dining room in the front of the restaurant and a more casual bar area around the back. The only difference is just a change of decor - we've always had great service on both sides and you can order the full menu even if you are sitting at the bar. During happy hour they have deals on their drinks and appetizers. I really like their crab cakes and egg rolls. I don't actually eat sushi, but my boyfriend loves the Las Vegas roll. I feel like the non-happy hour food is a little bit pricey but it's definitely not unreasonable. If you are in the area you should totally check this place out. It's a great spot to hang out with friends and family over dinner!

WePe6BYA60d80Rugmgtjeg.text: The Bulgogi beef dynamite roll was very tasty, will be coming back to try more of their sushi rolls!

Jt7WuFmGoup8Se2nWK9prw.text: Place was very cozy and waitress was wonderful. Food was ready quick and it was delicious!

cyb5y7P7M7Nh1f42IhQpHA.text: This place was so awesome.  What stated out as a late dinner date ended up being one of the funnest night date nights ever. The food was spot on. And the bar in the back was loads of fun with great Saki and karaoke till 2am. We will definitely be back!

MJfSnDzbyUJ3sYPCpzCTjQ.text: Excellent sushi restaurant. I'm a sushi lover and this is my favorite restaurant by far! I always come and order the Vegas Roll, Caterpillar Roll, spicy tuna roll. Pretty much anything you order on the menu is amazing! They have the best Egg rolls and Tempura vegetables. The service is phenomenal as well!

2VCPs9KZkmVhgFScDXUcMQ.text: Super awesome place. Delicious food and great prices. My girlfriend and I both enjoy this Asian delight.

JMtBCYorw5h4i-izhFH1Fw.text: This place was soooo good for happy hour.  They have happy hour 7 days a week and we ended up getting 2 saki bombs, 3 different skewers (all amazing), edamame, and egg rolls (also amazing) totaling $30.  It's got parking, and is low key so wasn't too busy when we went.  All the food came out at different times, but was perfect for happy hour and was so quick.  Overall, highly recommend.

zZUbH15a-C3bh3MvCVU8MQ.text: If this was just a few miles closer to my house I'd eat here weekly! Everything we've had here has always been amazing!! And their recommendation to come with a group is key! There's so much to try it's hard to resist ordering too much food!   I'm glad they have a sushi menu now, I think when they first opened they didn't. But their rolls are just as good as their sister location, Bei.  And their hot pots are so amazing, but they can feed a crowd!!! Most recently I tried their coconut curry one and it is DIVINE!!!

JwIlQPg4VNF5jTOWYzYUeQ.text: Overpriced with limited sushi options. When, we came it, they tried to get us to move next door(?) and sit in the bar area even though they had plenty of open seats in the dining room.  Not sure if they are not getting enough business in that area, but after we sat down, we watched as they sent a group of 5 over there and they all came back 30 seconds later.    Service was ok, nothing special; as the young girls move from serving tables to charging and checking their phones by the front desk.  The best part of the meal were the bulgogi tacos I ordered, so I assume some of the Korean dishes and skewers are good; but this is not a sushi place that we expected.

TJ7Lwddz_vi3wLEKW_ZOHg.text: First time in, found this place while looking for something else.  The menu was sort of sushi  + yakitori + izakaya + Korean.  Very wide range of food.  We started with a couple of skewers, shrimp, chicken, and scallops the first two were fine,  except for the scallops,  more on that later. . . Then we had a couple of sushi rolls, spider crab and spicy tuna with toasted garlic.  The later being a new favorite for me.   We finished with a couple of hotpots, mussels and spicy mixed seafood.  Also one of our party had a HUGE yellowtail collar.  All were very good and we finished all we could hold.    Back to the scallops, if you cook, you know that some shellfish is sold by the units/lb.  U-16/20 shrimp are 16 to 20 shrimp per pound or a little less than an ounce per shrimp.  Zu advertises and had on the menu "U-10" Scallops.  That's 1.6 oz. per scallop, just the right size to sear.  We expected 2 orders of BIG scallops, roasted yakitori style.   We got scallops, they were maybe U-16s or less.  Tiny, about 3/4 of an inch in diameter.  So don't order the scallops and you should be OK.  I suggest the manager either get some dry U-10s to grill, or take the "U-10" reference off the menu.

3XlVf1FPCfNOb64BImPqFA.text: I came here with my team for happy hour on my birthday and it was great! We enjoyed almost everything we ordered, specifically the grilled zucchini and curry hot pot. The sushi was also nice and fresh. I like that they have an extensive menu for both happy hour and entree options, plus it's close by! We'll be back :)

6mRc4LgJUSDJkY5nI41IiQ.text: I've eaten here twice and everything on the menu has been a hit; along with their music playlist. Will definitely be back.

nad2XCRl8cuFj_cynxKVsg.text: Great food with quick, attentive service! Stopped by for the happy hour and was not disappointed. Had the egg rolls, shrimp tempura roll and jalapeno Vegas roll which was presented beautifully. Perfect dinner on this overcast day.

FbIfd8qmjLI5i5gJrGYv2g.text: Food was excellent. My review is more to make a point to the serving staff of how to handle a mistake. I ordered the Jalapeno Yellowtail Roll with ponzu sauce. The server spilt the ponzu sauce all over my pants. Her remedy was to hand me a few napkins. I got up and walked to where the kitchen entrance was and got a rag and soda water to get the staining out. I was sitting with soaked jeans for most my dinner. Not very enjoyable. When my bill came they did nothing for me. I had to ask for the manager to comp the roll for the inconvenience. Based on that alone I don't think I'll be back.

S2FrbUQfcTUVZQEukuCrVQ.text: Food was great!  Came in for a late night snack.. had some tuna, salmon, the chili shrimp, and gyoza... everything was great!  Especially the shrimp!

SiLxZw-IE9Wj1HmSAA5mbg.text: Great food! The environment is amazing and the workers are friendly and helpful. Food is reasonably priced and great quality. New favorite restaurant in the area

jiLBIFSCULDWYzQwmBoPJQ.text: We visited Zu while in town for a few days. The service was good and menu had good variety. My daughter is very picky and she loved the chicken skewer.   We tried a few sushi rolls and they were hit or miss. I would have liked to try a few more but liked the garlic spicy tuna. The jalapeno vegas roll was not my favorite.

xY7LGgY-Ivc3CTh4qG_j4Q.text: Was considering a few of the other sushi places in Tempe and we decided to try this one. We were not disappointed! This place was excellent. Their happy hour menu is a great deal. Gyoza, Las Vegas roll, and the spicy edamame were amazing- not to mention the attentive service! We will definitely be coming back!

mTN1x6vRxTD2WLEYWXo_VA.text: Hot pots are amazing! Staff is great... Especially Kevin. He's my favorite and always so funny. This has definitely become my go to place for delicious food and a perfect atmosphere...not to mention the best happy hour and Kevin!

V9fh8HAFfTQgr_rIVY-xAA.text: Wanting to try something new, I was very curious about their "tapas" style portions. When I walked in, I was greeted by a host and then had the options of two tables.   Zu had a really great selection of food - skewers, hot pot, sushi/sashimi. I ordered the pork (8.5/10) and steak (3/10) skewer. From the sashimi menu, I ordered the salmon and seared tuna. The size of the sashimi was a little on the smaller side. The salmon was okay. I would recommend the seared tuna - 9/10. From the hotpot menu, I ordered the Nagasaki Seafood Pot - comes with assorted seafood, vegetables and ramen noodles. I added spam on the side too but the server forgot about it. There wasn't anything too special about it for the price $16.95. I probably wouldn't order it again.   I think overall the restaurant is ok. I wouldn't make the drive all the way from N. Scottsdale just to come here but if I am ever in the area, I would definitely stop in for the cheap skewers!

Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States. Nagasaki hotpot (added spam), steak and beef skewers

Bf50pJKwVEr67-6pf4eqFA.text: Nice little spot in Scottsdale while visiting for Spring Training for Oakland A's. Lots of food choices ( Japanese and Korean and even tacos)

qOQjoJzwiGowXF00Dw9b7g.text: Searching for an awesome Asian fusion experience in south Scottsdale? Then look no further than Zu Izakaya.   Unpretentious - this is definitely a great little spot to get your fix. The service is spot on, the food & drink menu is impressive, and the quality is top notch.  After stopping in for the first time, on my birthday in mid-August, I've decided that this is going to be my go-to sushi joint.  From their most basic sashimi and nigiri to their more creative rolls and  Sushi Burrito, I was thoroughly satisfied with the selection and left happy with a full belly and a smile on my face.  I have a feeling that you will to. Be sure to stop in and stay at Zu Izakaya for their Happy Hour specials and let the adventure begin. Now pass the Soju and Sake!  KANPAI!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zu Izakaya Asian Kitchen - Tempe, AZ, United States

bAfg7c-S5Cmg6ct5olIYSw.text: I've been here several times already. It's become one of my favorites. They have a variety of dishes to try and I have yet to try them all. So far, the bulgolgi was on point, and we've tried the bulgolgi mushroom hotpot which was delicious too. I've also tried their skewers. The scallops were ginormous! And cooked perfectly. We haven't had a bad experience yet and looking forward to going back.
